data.name: Thing_StructureComputer_Description
Thing_StructureConsole_Description
data.value: This {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor} and {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, depending on which {LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard} is inserted into the unit. It has a shared data/power port. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.
data.comment: This {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor} and {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, depending on which {LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard} is inserted into the unit. It has a shared data/power port. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.

It has separate data and power ports. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.

data.name: Thing_StructureControlChair_Description
data.value: Once, these chairs were the heart of space-going behemoths. Now, they're items of nostalgia built only by a handful of Stationeers with a sense of history. In other words, kitsch.
data.comment: Once, these chairs were the heart of space-going behemoths. Now, they're items of nostalgia built only by a handful of Stationeers with a sense of history. In other words, kitsch.

data.name: Thing_StructureConveyorCorner_Description
data.value: Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'
data.comment: Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

data.name: Thing_StructureConveyorRiser_Description
data.value: Originally designed by {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places - and up slightly, in the case of the riser. An recurring {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

data.name: Thing_StructureCryoTube_Description
data.value: The exact operation of the Longsleep cryotube remains a commercial secret, with {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} merely licensing the design. Able to regenerate organ damage when supplied with power and an atmosphere, the Longsleep is a minor miracle of modern medical technology.
data.comment: The exact operation of the Longsleep cryotube remains a commercial secret, with {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} merely licensing the design. Able to regenerate organ damage when supplied with power and an atmosphere, the Longsleep is a minor miracle of modern medical technology.

data.name: Thing_StructureDaylightSensor_Description
data.value: Daylight sensors provide data on whether the current region of your base is in sunlight, and report the exact solar angle. Note that the orientation of the sensor alters the reported solar angle, while {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems can be used to offset it.
data.comment: Daylight sensors provide data on whether the current region of your base is in sunlight, and report the exact solar angle. Note that the orientation of the sensor alters the reported solar angle, while {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems can be used to offset it.

data.name: Thing_StructureDigitalValve_Description
data.value: The digital valve allows {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} to create {LINK:LogicPage;logic-controlled} valves and pipe networks.
data.comment: The digital valve allows {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} to create {LINK:LogicPage;logic-controlled} valves and pipe networks.

data.name: Thing_StructureFabricator_Description
data.value: Capable of manufacturing a vast array of items, the {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} General Fabricator was considered too risky by the {LINK:ODA;ODA} for widespread use. Certainly, it has been used for purposes beyond those it was intended, including counterfeiting, terrorism, and bad art. As a result, its deployment is now heavily regulated.
data.comment: Capable of manufacturing a vast array of items, the {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} General Fabricator was considered too risky by the {LINK:ODA;ODA} for widespread use. Certainly, it has been used for purposes beyond those it was intended, including counterfeiting, terrorism, and bad art. As a result, its deployment is now heavily regulated.

data.name: Thing_StructureFiltration_Description
data.value: The Filtration Unit is based on a long-standing {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} system, itself based on older designs of uncertain provenance. It is available in the {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}. The device has nonetheless proven indispensable for {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} atmospheric systems, as it can filter two {LINK:GasPage;gases} simultaneously from a single pipe network using a dual filter array. The unit has an input, and a filter output as well as an unfiltered outlet for any residual gases.
data.comment: The Filtration Unit is based on a long-standing {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} system, itself based on older designs of uncertain provenance. It is available in the {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}. The device has nonetheless proven indispensable for {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} atmospheric systems, as it can filter two {LINK:GasPage;gases} simultaneously from a single pipe network using a dual filter array. The unit has an input, and a filter output as well as an unfiltered outlet for any residual gases.

data.name: Thing_StructureFlashingLight_Description
data.value: Few objects or ideas are as clearly and transparently named as the Flashing Light, although fans of scrupulous accuracy have been known to refer to it by its full, official title: 'Default Yellow Flashing Light'.
data.comment: Few objects or ideas are as clearly and transparently named as the Flashing Light, although fans of scrupulous accuracy have been known to refer to it by its full, official title: 'Default Yellow Flashing Light'.

data.name: Thing_StructureFrame_Description
data.value: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also have several variations for more complex constructions, such as the {THING:StructureFrameCorner} and {THING:StructureFrameCornerCut}. Like iron frames, they are placed then completed by welding {THING:ItemSteelSheets} to the open framework.
data.comment: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also have several variations for more complex constructions, such as the {THING:StructureFrameCorner} and {THING:StructureFrameCornerCut}. Like iron frames, they are placed then completed by welding {THING:ItemSteelSheets} to the open framework.

data.name: Thing_StructureFrameCorner_Description
data.value: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also offer several variations for more complex lattice constructions. With a little patience and maneuvering, the corner frame's Gothic-inspired silhouette allows the creation of ogival arches and even more ambitious architecture, although they are not airtight and cannot be built on.
data.comment: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also offer several variations for more complex lattice constructions. With a little patience and maneuvering, the corner frame's Gothic-inspired silhouette allows the creation of ogival arches and even more ambitious architecture, although they are not airtight and cannot be built on.

data.name: Thing_StructureFrameSide_Description
data.value: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also provide variations for more ornate constructions.
data.comment: More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also provide variations for more ornate constructions.

data.name: Thing_StructureFurnace_Description
data.value: The Zhurong furnace employs a high-temperature gas mixture of {GAS:Oxygen} and {GAS:Volatiles} to smelt {LINK:IngotPage;ingots} and a range of {LINK:IngotPage;alloys} as raw materials for {LINK:FabricatorPage;fabricators}. A basic gas mixture can be achieved by adding {THING:ItemOxite} and {THING:ItemVolatiles} in a 1:2 ratio directly to the furnace, but more complex alloys will require careful management of a dedicated gas mixing network. Exact ingredient ratios must be observed. Likewise, smelting ores at insufficient temperatures will produce {LINK:ReagentPage;reagents}, which must be recycled. If liquids are present in the furnace, they will gather there until the furnace is connected to a liquid pipe network.
data.comment: The Zhurong furnace employs a high-temperature gas mixture of {GAS:Oxygen} and {GAS:Volatiles} to smelt {LINK:IngotPage;ingots} and a range of {LINK:IngotPage;alloys} as raw materials for {LINK:FabricatorPage;fabricators}. A basic gas mixture can be achieved by adding {THING:ItemOxite} and {THING:ItemVolatiles} in a 1:2 ratio directly to the furnace, but more complex alloys will require careful management of a dedicated gas mixing network. Exact ingredient ratios must be observed. Likewise, smelting ores at insufficient temperatures will produce {LINK:ReagentPage;reagents}, which must be recycled. If liquids are present in the furnace, they will gather there until the furnace is connected to a liquid pipe network.

data.name: Thing_StructureGasMixer_Description
data.value: Indispensable for producing precise atmospheric ratios, this gas mixer blends two gases in proportions ranging anywhere from 0-100%.
data.comment: Indispensable for producing precise atmospheric ratios, this gas mixer blends two gases in proportions ranging anywhere from 0-100%.

data.name: Thing_StructureGasSensor_Description
data.value: Gas sensors are designed to monitor and report basic atmospheric information, including temperature, pressure, and gas ratios. They also make wonderful wedding presents.
data.comment: Gas sensors are designed to monitor and report basic atmospheric information, including temperature, pressure, and gas ratios. They also make wonderful wedding presents.

data.name: Thing_StructureGasTankStorage_Description
data.value: When connected to a pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}.
data.comment: When connected to a pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}.

data.name: Thing_StructureLiquidTankStorage_Description
data.value: When connected to a liquid pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}. It will not accept gas canisters.
data.comment: When connected to a liquid pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the {SLOT:GasCanister}. It will not accept gas canisters.

data.name: Thing_StructureGyroscope_Description
data.value: An element of an ancient class of spaceship, the gyroscope allowed these vehicles to rotate in at least one of the universe's most popular directions.
data.comment: An element of an ancient class of spaceship, the gyroscope allowed these vehicles to rotate in at least one of the universe's most popular directions.

data.name: Thing_StructureHydroponicsTray_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics tray is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}.
data.comment: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics tray is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}.

data.name: Thing_StructureIgniter_Description
data.value: It gets the party started. Especially if that party is an explosive gas mixture.
data.comment: It gets the party started. Especially if that party is an explosive gas mixture.

data.name: Thing_StructureLocker_Description
data.value: If a tidy base is the sign of a ordered mind, lockers are the righteous post upon which that sign hangs.
data.comment: If a tidy base is the sign of a ordered mind, lockers are the righteous post upon which that sign hangs.

data.name: Thing_StructureMotionSensor_Description
data.value: Originally developed to monitor dance marathons, the motion sensor can also be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems for security purposes, automatic lighting, doors and various other applications. The sensor activates whenever a player enters the grid it is placed on.
data.comment: Originally developed to monitor dance marathons, the motion sensor can also be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems for security purposes, automatic lighting, doors and various other applications. The sensor activates whenever a player enters the grid it is placed on.

data.name: Thing_StructurePassiveVent_Description
data.value: Passive vents allow gases to move into and out of pipe networks, which are closed systems unless connected to a device or structure. Passive vents are not powered, merely an aperture, essentially turning an enclosed space into part of the pipe network.
data.comment: Passive vents allow gases to move into and out of pipe networks, which are closed systems unless connected to a device or structure. Passive vents are not powered, merely an aperture, essentially turning an enclosed space into part of the pipe network.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeAnalysizer_Description
data.value: Allegedly the outcome of a weekend father-daughter electronics project by an overzealous {{LINK:ExMin;ExMin} engineer, the pipe analyzer is essentially a more advanced version of the {THING:StructurePipeMeter}. Displaying the internal pressure of pipe networks, it also reads out temperature and gas contents, and can be connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} or {THING:StructureComputer} via a {{LINK:LogicPage;Logic} system.
data.comment: Allegedly the outcome of a weekend father-daughter electronics project by an overzealous {{LINK:ExMin;ExMin} engineer, the pipe analyzer is essentially a more advanced version of the {THING:StructurePipeMeter}. Displaying the internal pressure of pipe networks, it also reads out temperature and gas contents, and can be connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} or {THING:StructureComputer} via a {{LINK:LogicPage;Logic} system.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeCorner_Description
data.value: The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.
data.comment: The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeLabel_Description
data.value: As its perspicacious name suggests, the pipe label is designed to be attached to a straight stretch of pipe. Users can then label the label with the {THING:ItemLabeller}.
data.comment: As its perspicacious name suggests, the pipe label is designed to be attached to a straight stretch of pipe. Users can then label the label with the {THING:ItemLabeller}.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeMeter_Description
data.value: While the Stationeers program has, thus far, inspired little in the way of classical poetry, the following haiku was found etched, ironically, on a piece of pipe wreckage found on Vulcan: "Humble pipe meter speaks the truth, transmits pressure within any pipe"
data.comment: While the Stationeers program has, thus far, inspired little in the way of classical poetry, the following haiku was found etched, ironically, on a piece of pipe wreckage found on Vulcan: "Humble pipe meter speaks the truth, transmits pressure within any pipe"

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeRadiator_Description
data.value: A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added the gas within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the gas in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
data.comment: A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added the gas within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the gas in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.

data.name: Thing_StructurePowerConnector_Description
data.value: Attaches a {THING:ItemKitDynamicGenerator} to a power network.
data.comment: Attaches a {THING:ItemKitDynamicGenerator} to a power network.

data.name: Thing_StructurePressureRegulator_Description
data.value: Controlling the flow of gas between two pipe networks, pressure regulators shift gas until a set pressure on the outlet side is achieved, or the gas supply is exhausted. The back pressure regulator, by contrast, will only operate when pressure on the intake side exceeds the set value. With a max pressure of over 20,000kPa, it requires power to operate.
data.comment: Controlling the flow of gas between two pipe networks, pressure regulators shift gas until a set pressure on the outlet side is achieved, or the gas supply is exhausted. The back pressure regulator, by contrast, will only operate when pressure on the intake side exceeds the set value. With a max pressure of over 20,000kPa, it requires power to operate.

data.name: Thing_StructureRTG_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec}RTG (radioisotope thermoelectric generator) uses the heat output of radioactive decay to generate voltage via a temperature differential across a thermocouple. Normally restricted to low energy devices, the RTG is rumored to exploit Zrillian engineering to achieve its improbably high power output.
data.comment: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec}RTG (radioisotope thermoelectric generator) uses the heat output of radioactive decay to generate voltage via a temperature differential across a thermocouple. Normally restricted to low energy devices, the RTG is rumored to exploit Zrillian engineering to achieve its improbably high power output.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolarPanel_Description
data.value: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's} standard solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight. They can be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
data.comment: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's} standard solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight. They can be connected to {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

data.name: Thing_StructureSorter_Description
data.value: No amount of automation is complete without some way of moving different items to different parts of a system. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} A2B sorter can be programmed via a computer with a {THING:MotherboardSorter} to direct various items into different chute networks. Filtered items are always passed out the righthand side of the sorter, while non filtered items continue straight through.
data.comment: No amount of automation is complete without some way of moving different items to different parts of a system. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} A2B sorter can be programmed via a computer with a {THING:MotherboardSorter} to direct various items into different chute networks. Filtered items are always passed out the righthand side of the sorter, while non filtered items continue straight through.

data.name: Thing_StructureStacker_Description
data.value: A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.
data.comment: A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.

data.name: Thing_StructureStackerReverse_Description
data.value: A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The reversed stacker has power and data on the opposite side. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.
data.comment: A stacker is an important part of any automated chute network. The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} ProKompile can be set manually or via logic, to make sure items passing through the stacker are maximized for your storage needs. The reversed stacker has power and data on the opposite side. The ProKompile can stack a wide variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;ingots}, as well as splitting stacks into appropriate sizes as needed.

data.name: Thing_StructureSuitStorage_Description
data.value: As tidy as it is useful, the suit storage rack holds an {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} and a {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}. When powered and connected to {THING:Oxygen} and {THING:Propellant}, it will recharge the suit's batteries, refill the {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} and your {THING:ItemGasFilterNitrogen} {SLOT:GasCanister}. The wastetank will be pumped out to the pipe connected to the waste outlet. All the rack's pipes must be connected or the unit will show an error state, but it will still charge the battery.
data.comment: As tidy as it is useful, the suit storage rack holds an {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} and a {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}. When powered and connected to {THING:Oxygen} and {THING:Propellant}, it will recharge the suit's batteries, refill the {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} and your {THING:ItemGasFilterNitrogen} {SLOT:GasCanister}. The wastetank will be pumped out to the pipe connected to the waste outlet. All the rack's pipes must be connected or the unit will show an error state, but it will still charge the battery.

data.name: Thing_StructureTankConnector_Description
data.value: Tank connectors are basic mounting devices that allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterEmpty} to a gas pipe network.
data.comment: Tank connectors are basic mounting devices that allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterEmpty} to a gas pipe network.

data.name: Thing_StructureTankConnectorLiquid_Description
data.value: These basic mounting devices allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty} to a liquid pipe network.
data.comment: These basic mounting devices allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty} to a liquid pipe network.

data.name: Thing_StructureVolumePump_Description
data.value: The volume pump pumps pumpable gases. It also separates out pipe networks into separate networks.
data.comment: The volume pump pumps pumpable gases. It also separates out pipe networks into separate networks.

data.name: Thing_StructureWallCooler_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Freezy Boi wall cooler complements the wall heater, which can only raise the temperature. The wall cooler functions by drawing heat from the surrounding atmosphere and adding that heat into its pipe network. In order to run the wall cooler properly, you will need to connect pipes to the wall cooler and fill the connected pipe network with any type of gas. The gas's heat capacity and volume will determine how fast it reacts to temperature changes.
{HEADER:EFFICIENCY} The higher the difference in temperature between the gas stored in the pipes and the room, the less efficient the wall cooler will be. So to keep the wall cooler running at an acceptable efficiency you will need to get rid of the heat that accumulates in the pipes connected to it. A common practice would be to run the pipes to the outside and use radiators on the outside section of the pipes to get rid of the heat. The less efficient the wall cooler, the less power it consumes. It will consume 1010W at max efficiency. The wall cooler can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain degree. {HEADER:ERRORS} If the wall cooler is flashing an error then it is missing one of the following:
- Pipe connection to the wall cooler. - Gas in the connected pipes, or pressure is too low. - Atmosphere in the surrounding environment or pressure is too low.
For more information about how to control temperatures, consult the {LINK:TemperatureControlPage;temperature control} Guides page.
data.comment:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Freezy Boi wall cooler complements the wall heater, which can only raise the temperature. The wall cooler functions by drawing heat from the surrounding atmosphere and adding that heat into its pipe network. In order to run the wall cooler properly, you will need to connect pipes to the wall cooler and fill the connected pipe network with any type of gas. The gas's heat capacity and volume will determine how fast it reacts to temperature changes.
{HEADER:EFFICIENCY} The higher the difference in temperature between the gas stored in the pipes and the room, the less efficient the wall cooler will be. So to keep the wall cooler running at an acceptable efficiency you will need to get rid of the heat that accumulates in the pipes connected to it. A common practice would be to run the pipes to the outside and use radiators on the outside section of the pipes to get rid of the heat. The less efficient the wall cooler, the less power it consumes. It will consume 1010W at max efficiency. The wall cooler can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain degree. {HEADER:ERRORS} If the wall cooler is flashing an error then it is missing one of the following:
- Pipe connection to the wall cooler. - Gas in the connected pipes, or pressure is too low. - Atmosphere in the surrounding environment or pressure is too low.
For more information about how to control temperatures, consult the {LINK:TemperatureControlPage;temperature control} Guides page.

data.name: Thing_StructureWallHeater_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} wall heater is a simple device that can be installed on a wall or frame and connected to power. When switched on, it will start heating the surrounding environment. It consumes 1010W of power and can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain level.
data.comment: The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} wall heater is a simple device that can be installed on a wall or frame and connected to power. When switched on, it will start heating the surrounding environment. It consumes 1010W of power and can be controlled by logic chips to run when the temperature hits a certain level.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolidFuelGenerator_Description
data.value: The mainstay of power generation for Stationeers, this device provides 20kW of power. Multiple solid resources can be loaded. While operating, the device will output its maximum power regardless of whether you have captured it or not. Watch for blown wires! It will output much more power than your regular {THING:ItemCableCoil} can handle.
data.comment: The mainstay of power generation for Stationeers, this device provides 20kW of power. Multiple solid resources can be loaded. While operating, the device will output its maximum power regardless of whether you have captured it or not. Watch for blown wires! It will output much more power than your regular {THING:ItemCableCoil} can handle.

data.name: Thing_StructureTransformer_Description
data.value: The large {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} transformer is a critical component of extended {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} networks, controlling the maximum power that will flow down a cable. To prevent overloading, output can be set from 0 to 50,000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.
data.comment: The large {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} transformer is a critical component of extended {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} networks, controlling the maximum power that will flow down a cable. To prevent overloading, output can be set from 0 to 50,000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

data.name: Thing_StructureTransformerSmall_Description
data.value: Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.
data.comment: Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

data.name: Thing_StructureChuteWindow_Description
data.value: Chute's with windows let you see what's passing through your {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} network. But be warned, they are not insulated as other chutes are. Ices will melt.
data.comment: Chute's with windows let you see what's passing through your {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} network. But be warned, they are not insulated as other chutes are. Ices will melt.

data.name: Thing_StructureArcFurnace_Description
data.value: The simplest smelting system available to the average {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}, {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} arc furnace was forged itself in the depths of the Solar System to help explorational geologists determine the purity of potential asteroidal mining targets. Co-opted by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}, it now provides Stationeers with a way to produce pure ingots of various resources. The smelting process also releases a range of by product {LINK:GasPage;gases}, principally {GAS:Nitrogen}, {GAS:CarbonDioxide}, {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen} in differing ratios. These can be recaptured from the atmosphere by filtering, but also make the arc furnace a risk in closed environments. Unlike the more advanced {THING:StructureFurnace}, the arc furnace cannot create {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.
data.comment: The simplest smelting system available to the average {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}, {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} arc furnace was forged itself in the depths of the Solar System to help explorational geologists determine the purity of potential asteroidal mining targets. Co-opted by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}, it now provides Stationeers with a way to produce pure ingots of various resources. The smelting process also releases a range of by product {LINK:GasPage;gases}, principally {GAS:Nitrogen}, {GAS:CarbonDioxide}, {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen} in differing ratios. These can be recaptured from the atmosphere by filtering, but also make the arc furnace a risk in closed environments. Unlike the more advanced {THING:StructureFurnace}, the arc furnace cannot create {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

data.name: Thing_StructureAutolathe_Description
data.value: The foundation of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} fabrication systems, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autolathe is a multi-axis molecular compositional system. Its complexity demands considerable time to assemble, but it remains an indispensable creation tool. Upgrade the device using a {THING:AutolathePrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
data.comment: The foundation of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} fabrication systems, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autolathe is a multi-axis molecular compositional system. Its complexity demands considerable time to assemble, but it remains an indispensable creation tool. Upgrade the device using a {THING:AutolathePrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

data.name: Thing_ItemCableCoilHeavy_Description
data.value: Use heavy cable coil for power systems with large draws. Unlike {THING:StructureCableCoil}, which can only safely conduct 5kW, heavy cables can transmit up to 100kW.
data.comment: Use heavy cable coil for power systems with large draws. Unlike {THING:StructureCableCoil}, which can only safely conduct 5kW, heavy cables can transmit up to 100kW.

data.name: Thing_ItemSilverOre_Description
data.value: Silver is a chemical element with the symbol "Ag". Valued by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for its attractive luster and sheen, it is also used in a variety of {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronics} components and {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.
data.comment: Silver is a chemical element with the symbol "Ag". Valued by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for its attractive luster and sheen, it is also used in a variety of {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronics} components and {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

data.name: Thing_ItemNickelOre_Description
data.value: Nickel is a chemical element with the symbol "Ni" and is a rare metal commonly used as a plating to prevent corrosion. Sought after by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}, Nickel is also commonly used to create several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.
data.comment: Nickel is a chemical element with the symbol "Ni" and is a rare metal commonly used as a plating to prevent corrosion. Sought after by many {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}, Nickel is also commonly used to create several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

data.name: Thing_ItemLeadOre_Description
data.value: Lead is a chemical element with the symbol "Pb". It is a dense, heavy metal with a low melting point. Lead is a used to make a variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;alloys} like {THING:ItemSolderIngot} and munitions.
data.comment: Lead is a chemical element with the symbol "Pb". It is a dense, heavy metal with a low melting point. Lead is a used to make a variety of things such as {LINK:IngotPage;alloys} like {THING:ItemSolderIngot} and munitions.

data.name: Thing_ItemSoybean_Description
data.value: Soybeans grow at a moderate rate, but require atmospheric {GAS:Nitrogen} to grow. Its main use is to create {THING:ItemSoyOil}
data.comment: Soybeans grow at a moderate rate, but require atmospheric {GAS:Nitrogen} to grow. Its main use is to create {THING:ItemSoyOil}

data.name: Thing_ItemAngleGrinder_Description
data.value: Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder.
data.comment: Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder.

data.name: Thing_ItemSiliconOre_Description
data.value: Silicon is a chemical element with the symbol "Si" and is one of the most useful elements to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}. Readily available throughout the universe, silicon is used in a range of {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}, glass, plastics and various electronic components a Stationeer may need to complete their mission.
data.comment: Silicon is a chemical element with the symbol "Si" and is one of the most useful elements to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}. Readily available throughout the universe, silicon is used in a range of {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}, glass, plastics and various electronic components a Stationeer may need to complete their mission.

data.name: Thing_ItemFern_Description
data.value: There was a time, when Stationeers had to make {THING:ReagentFenoxitone} using the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor}. Recent advances in technology allow you to use equivalent quantities of fern directly in recipes.
data.comment: There was a time, when Stationeers had to make {THING:ReagentFenoxitone} using the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor}. Recent advances in technology allow you to use equivalent quantities of fern directly in recipes.

data.name: Thing_ItemCerealBar_Description
data.value: Sustains, without decay. If only all our relationships were so well balanced.
data.comment: Sustains, without decay. If only all our relationships were so well balanced.

data.name: Thing_StructureElectronicsPrinter_Description
data.value: The electronic printer will create any {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronic} part you need. From circuit boards and electronic devices to solar panels. The choice is yours. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ElectronicPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
data.comment: The electronic printer will create any {LINK:ElectronicPage;electronic} part you need. From circuit boards and electronic devices to solar panels. The choice is yours. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ElectronicPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

data.name: Thing_ItemVolatiles_Description
data.value:
An extremely reactive ice with numerous hydrocarbons trapped inside. For simplicity's sake, these are often displayed as H2 by devices like the {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}.
Volatiles combust in a 2:1 ratio with {GAS:Oxygen}, creating {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and pollutants. However when catalysed via devices such as the {THING:H2Combustor} in the presence of {GAS:Oxygen}, they produce {GAS:Steam} and heat with a modicum of {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and {GAS:Pollutant} due to the autoignition of the volatiles in the chamber. Along with {GAS:Oxygen}, volatiles gas is also the major component of fuel for such devices as the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch}.
data.comment:
An extremely reactive ice with numerous hydrocarbons trapped inside. For simplicity's sake, these are often displayed as H2 by devices like the {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}.
Volatiles combust in a 2:1 ratio with {GAS:Oxygen}, creating {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and pollutants. However when catalysed via devices such as the {THING:H2Combustor} in the presence of {GAS:Oxygen}, they produce {GAS:Steam} and heat with a modicum of {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and {GAS:Pollutant} due to the autoignition of the volatiles in the chamber. Along with {GAS:Oxygen}, volatiles gas is also the major component of fuel for such devices as the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch}.

data.name: Thing_ItemOxite_Description
data.value:
Oxite ice is largely composed of frozen {GAS:Oxygen}, and found on many planets in the Solar System. Highly valuable and sought after, not all planets a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} visits will have some.
Highly sensitive to temperature, oxite will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}. When melting, oxite produces a mixture of {GAS:Oxygen} and {GAS:Nitrogen}.
data.comment:
Oxite ice is largely composed of frozen {GAS:Oxygen}, and found on many planets in the Solar System. Highly valuable and sought after, not all planets a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} visits will have some.
Highly sensitive to temperature, oxite will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}. When melting, oxite produces a mixture of {GAS:Oxygen} and {GAS:Nitrogen}.

data.name: Thing_StructureHydraulicPipeBender_Description
data.value: A go-to tool for all your atmospheric and plumbing needs, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Atmoprinter will create everything from pipes, pumps and tanks, to vents and filters, ensuring your survival in any environment. Upgrade the Atmoprinter using a {THING:PipeBenderMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
data.comment: A go-to tool for all your atmospheric and plumbing needs, the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Atmoprinter will create everything from pipes, pumps and tanks, to vents and filters, ensuring your survival in any environment. Upgrade the Atmoprinter using a {THING:PipeBenderMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

data.name: Thing_StructureToolManufactory_Description
data.value: No mission can be completed without the proper tools. The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} ThuulDek manufactory can fabricate almost any tool or hand-held device a {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} may need to complete their mission, as well as a variety of delightful paints. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ToolPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
data.comment: No mission can be completed without the proper tools. The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} ThuulDek manufactory can fabricate almost any tool or hand-held device a {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} may need to complete their mission, as well as a variety of delightful paints. Upgrade the device using a {THING:ToolPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

data.name: Thing_StructureTransformerSmallReversed_Description
data.value: Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.
data.comment: Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolarPanelDual_Description
data.value: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} dual solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight, with dedicated data and power ports. They can be connected to {{LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
data.comment: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} dual solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight, with dedicated data and power ports. They can be connected to {{LINK:LogicPage;Logic} systems, in order to track sunlight, but their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

data.name: Thing_StructureRecycler_Description
data.value: A device for collecting the raw resources while destroying an item. Produces {THING:ItemReagentMix} containing packages of reagents. Pass these through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to gain back the source ores. Plants and organic matter passed through will create Biomass, which when passed through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} will produce {THING:ItemBiomass}.
data.comment: A device for collecting the raw resources while destroying an item. Produces {THING:ItemReagentMix} containing packages of reagents. Pass these through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to gain back the source ores. Plants and organic matter passed through will create Biomass, which when passed through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} will produce {THING:ItemBiomass}.

data.name: Thing_StructureLogicDial_Description
data.value: An assignable dial with up to 1000 modes.
data.comment: An assignable dial with up to 1000 modes.

data.name: Thing_ItemPotato_Description
data.value: Potatoes are a simple, fast growing crop that can keep Stationeers alive in emergencies.
data.comment: Potatoes are a simple, fast growing crop that can keep Stationeers alive in emergencies.

data.name: Thing_ItemTomato_Description
data.value: Tomato plants are perennial, and will produce multiple harvests without needing to be replanted. Once the plant is mature, it will fruit at a moderate pace.
data.comment: Tomato plants are perennial, and will produce multiple harvests without needing to be replanted. Once the plant is mature, it will fruit at a moderate pace.

data.name: Thing_DynamicGPR_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR), when used in conjunction with either a {THING:CartridgeOreScanner} or a {THING:CartridgeOreScannerColor} placed in a {THING:ItemTablet}, allows a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} to maximize mining yields and save time gathering resources to complete their mission by displaying hidden ores in the terrain.
Insert a cartridge or color scanner into the tablet, then press the activate button on the GPR to scan the surroundings. The data will be displayed on the tablet.
data.comment:
The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR), when used in conjunction with either a {THING:CartridgeOreScanner} or a {THING:CartridgeOreScannerColor} placed in a {THING:ItemTablet}, allows a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} to maximize mining yields and save time gathering resources to complete their mission by displaying hidden ores in the terrain.
Insert a cartridge or color scanner into the tablet, then press the activate button on the GPR to scan the surroundings. The data will be displayed on the tablet.

data.name: Thing_CartridgeOreScanner_Description
data.value: When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground on the tablet.
data.comment: When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground on the tablet.

data.name: Thing_ItemTomatoSoup_Description
data.value: Made using {THING:ItemCookedTomato}s and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}.
data.comment: Made using {THING:ItemCookedTomato}s and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}.

data.name: Thing_StructureOrganicsPrinter_Description
data.value: Please note, the organics printer has been deprecated - it is now spawnable in Creative mode only.
data.comment: Please note, the organics printer has been deprecated - it is now spawnable in Creative mode only.

data.name: Thing_StructureSecurityPrinter_Description
data.value: Any {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} concerned about security needs the {LINK:Harkwell;Harkwell-designed} Vigilant-E security printer. Use the Vigilant-E to create a {THING:CartridgeAccessController}, in order to restrict access to different parts of your base via keycards like the {THING:AccessCardBlue}. The printer also makes a variety of weapons and ammunitions to defend your base against any hostile, aggressive or just slightly rude entites you encounter as you explore the Solar System.
data.comment: Any {LINK:Stationeer;Stationeer} concerned about security needs the {LINK:Harkwell;Harkwell-designed} Vigilant-E security printer. Use the Vigilant-E to create a {THING:CartridgeAccessController}, in order to restrict access to different parts of your base via keycards like the {THING:AccessCardBlue}. The printer also makes a variety of weapons and ammunitions to defend your base against any hostile, aggressive or just slightly rude entites you encounter as you explore the Solar System.

data.name: Thing_StructureElectrolyzer_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} Electrolyzer splits {GAS:Water} into hydrogen and {GAS:Oxygen}. Employing unknown proprietary technology, the device uses water's latent heat as the energy to drive the electrosis process. If there is a downside to this near-miraculous fission, it's that the device is limited by the quantity of power available, which is used to maintain the temperature output. In other words, the machine works best with hot gas.
data.comment: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed} Electrolyzer splits {GAS:Water} into hydrogen and {GAS:Oxygen}. Employing unknown proprietary technology, the device uses water's latent heat as the energy to drive the electrosis process. If there is a downside to this near-miraculous fission, it's that the device is limited by the quantity of power available, which is used to maintain the temperature output. In other words, the machine works best with hot gas.

data.name: Thing_StructureVendingMachine_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo-designed} 'Slot Mate' vending machine allows storage of almost any item, while also operating as a distribution point for working with {LINK:TradingPage;Traders}. You cannot trade without a vending machine, or its more advanced equivalent, the {THING:StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine}. Each vending machine can hold up to 100 stacks.
data.comment: The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo-designed} 'Slot Mate' vending machine allows storage of almost any item, while also operating as a distribution point for working with {LINK:TradingPage;Traders}. You cannot trade without a vending machine, or its more advanced equivalent, the {THING:StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine}. Each vending machine can hold up to 100 stacks.

data.name: Thing_ItemHardsuitHelmet_Description
data.value: The Hardsuit Helmet is similar to the {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, but can withstand higher temperatures and pressures. It's perfect for enduring harsh environments like Venus and Vulcan.
data.comment: The Hardsuit Helmet is similar to the {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, but can withstand higher temperatures and pressures. It's perfect for enduring harsh environments like Venus and Vulcan.

data.name: Thing_StructureUnloader_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Re:Gurge is a handy unit for unloading any items inserted into it, and feeding them into a chute network. For instance, if you add a full {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, the Re:Gurge will empty a mining belt of its contents, insert them into the chute network, then insert the mining belt itself. A {THING:StructureSorter} is recommended to reclaim the mining belt.
Output = 0 exporting the main item Output = 1 exporting items inside and eventually the main item.
data.comment:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Re:Gurge is a handy unit for unloading any items inserted into it, and feeding them into a chute network. For instance, if you add a full {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, the Re:Gurge will empty a mining belt of its contents, insert them into the chute network, then insert the mining belt itself. A {THING:StructureSorter} is recommended to reclaim the mining belt.
Output = 0 exporting the main item Output = 1 exporting items inside and eventually the main item.

data.name: Thing_ItemMushroom_Description
data.value: A tasty food item. Unlike normal plants, it consumes {GAS:Oxygen} and outputs {GAS:CarbonDioxide}. Mushrooms will only mature at a moderate rate in darkness, and prolonged light will kill it.
data.comment: A tasty food item. Unlike normal plants, it consumes {GAS:Oxygen} and outputs {GAS:CarbonDioxide}. Mushrooms will only mature at a moderate rate in darkness, and prolonged light will kill it.

data.name: Thing_ItemPumpkin_Description
data.value: Pumpkins are a perennial plant, with both a long growth time, and a long time between harvests. Its low requirement for darkness allows for accelerated growing if provided with extra light.
data.comment: Pumpkins are a perennial plant, with both a long growth time, and a long time between harvests. Its low requirement for darkness allows for accelerated growing if provided with extra light.

data.name: Thing_ItemRice_Description
data.value: Rice grows at a moderate rate as long as its supplied with plenty of water. Being more dependant on water, rice plants can easily die during periods of drought.
data.comment: Rice grows at a moderate rate as long as its supplied with plenty of water. Being more dependant on water, rice plants can easily die during periods of drought.

data.name: Thing_ItemHardBackpack_Description
data.value: This backpack can be useful when you are working inside and don't need to fly around.
data.comment: This backpack can be useful when you are working inside and don't need to fly around.

data.name: Thing_ItemHardJetpack_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack at all, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. The hardsuit jetpack is capable of much higher speeds than the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} - up to 15m/s. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has fourteen storage slots. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
data.comment: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack at all, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. The hardsuit jetpack is capable of much higher speeds than the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} - up to 15m/s. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has fourteen storage slots. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.

data.name: Thing_StructureKlaxon_Description
data.value: Klaxons allow you to play over 50 announcements and sounds, depending on your {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} set-up. Set the mode to select the output.
data.comment: Klaxons allow you to play over 50 announcements and sounds, depending on your {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} set-up. Set the mode to select the output.

data.name: Thing_CartridgeOreScannerColor_Description
data.value:
When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground in different colors on the tablet.
Iron and Nickle = red Ice, Lead, Cobalt = cyan Gold and Silver = green Coal and Silicon = magenta Copper and Oxite = yellow Volatiles and Uranium = white
data.comment:
When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground in different colors on the tablet.
Iron and Nickle = red Ice, Lead, Cobalt = cyan Gold and Silver = green Coal and Silicon = magenta Copper and Oxite = yellow Volatiles and Uranium = white

data.name: Thing_MotherboardProgrammableChip_Description
data.value: When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer}, the IC Editor allows players to write and edit IC code, which can then be uploaded to a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} if housed in an {THING:StructureCircuitHousing}.
data.comment: When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer}, the IC Editor allows players to write and edit IC code, which can then be uploaded to a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} if housed in an {THING:StructureCircuitHousing}.

data.name: Thing_StructureShuttleLandingPad_Description
data.value: Landing pad capable of handling a small trade shuttle. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} enables the ability to trade with suppliers. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.
data.comment: Landing pad capable of handling a small trade shuttle. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} enables the ability to trade with suppliers. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.

data.name: Thing_StructureSatelliteDish_Description
data.value:
This medium communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.
data.comment:
This medium communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.

data.name: Thing_MotherboardComms_Description
data.value: When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer} and connected to a {THING:Landingpad_DataConnectionPiece}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust the horizontal and vertical attributes of the {THING:StructureSatelliteDish} either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader. A minimum of a 3x3 clear pad area with a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01} at the center is required for a trader to land.
data.comment: When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer} and connected to a {THING:Landingpad_DataConnectionPiece}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust the horizontal and vertical attributes of the {THING:StructureSatelliteDish} either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader. A minimum of a 3x3 clear pad area with a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01} at the center is required for a trader to land.

data.name: Thing_ItemMiningDrillHeavy_Description
data.value: Sometimes mining trips require something a little bigger to bring home the goods. This scaled up version of the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Topo' design {THING:ItemMiningDrill} can literally move mountains. The heavy mining drill will remove more ground and mine {LINK:OrePage;ore} more quickly than the standard mining drill. The heavy mining drill is also resilient to temperature and pressure. So no matter what planet or extreme weather conditions may be present, the Recurso heavy mining drill will get the job done.
data.comment: Sometimes mining trips require something a little bigger to bring home the goods. This scaled up version of the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Topo' design {THING:ItemMiningDrill} can literally move mountains. The heavy mining drill will remove more ground and mine {LINK:OrePage;ore} more quickly than the standard mining drill. The heavy mining drill is also resilient to temperature and pressure. So no matter what planet or extreme weather conditions may be present, the Recurso heavy mining drill will get the job done.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolarPanelFused_Description
data.value: Used for generating power from sunlight. Efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair it using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
data.comment: Used for generating power from sunlight. Efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair it using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

data.name: Thing_Robot_Description
data.value:
Designed by - presumably drunk - {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} roboticists, AIMeE (or Automated Independent Mechanical Entity) can be a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} best friend, or tiresome nemesis, or both several times in the same day.
Intended to unearth and retrieve ores automatically, the unit requires basic programming knowledge to operate, and {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip}.
AIMEe has 7 modes:
RobotMode.None = 0 = Do nothing RobotMode.None = 1 = Follow nearest player RobotMode.None = 2 = Move to target in straight line RobotMode.None = 3 = Wander around looking for ores in 15 co-ords radius RobotMode.None = 4 = Unload in chute input or chute bin within 3 meters / 1.5 large grids RobotMode.None = 5 = Path(find) to target RobotMode.None = 6 = Automatic assigned state, shows when storage slots are full
data.comment:

Intended to unearth and retrieve ores automatically, the unit requires basic programming knowledge to operate, and {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip}.

data.name: Thing_StructureAdvancedFurnace_Description
data.value: The advanced furnace comes with integrated inlet and outlet pumps for controlling the unit's internal pressure.
data.comment: The advanced furnace comes with integrated inlet and outlet pumps for controlling the unit's internal pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemAstroloyIngot_Description
data.value: Due to the original Stationeer manual collapsing into a singularity, Astroloy recipes have been warped by spacetime contortions. The correct Astroloy recipe, as memorialized for all time in a series of charming plastic icons, is 1.0 Copper, 1.0 Cobalt, and 2.0 Steel.
data.comment: Due to the original Stationeer manual collapsing into a singularity, Astroloy recipes have been warped by spacetime contortions. The correct Astroloy recipe, as memorialized for all time in a series of charming plastic icons, is 1.0 Copper, 1.0 Cobalt, and 2.0 Steel.

data.name: Thing_ItemCobaltOre_Description
data.value: Cobalt is a chemical element with the symbol "Co" and is typically found in only small deposits. Cobalt is a rare substance, but used create the {THING:ItemHealPill} and several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.
data.comment: Cobalt is a chemical element with the symbol "Co" and is typically found in only small deposits. Cobalt is a rare substance, but used create the {THING:ItemHealPill} and several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

data.comment: Apply to an {THING:StructureElectronicsPrinter} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.

data.name: Thing_StructureTransformerMedium_Description
data.value: Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a sub-network of cables, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

data.name: Thing_ItemJetpackBasic_Description
data.value: The basic {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stabilizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
data.comment: The basic {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stabilizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.

data.name: Thing_StructureAutoMinerSmall_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} SquareDig autominer is a structure that when built will mine a vertical 2x2 shaft until it hits bedrock. The autominer can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the autominer outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area.
data.comment: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} SquareDig autominer is a structure that when built will mine a vertical 2x2 shaft until it hits bedrock. The autominer can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the autominer outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area.

data.name: Thing_ItemDirtCanister_Description
data.value: A container the will fill with Dirt when using a {THING:ItemMiningDrill} when placed inside a {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. You can then use this {SLOT:DirtCanister} with the {THING:ItemTerrainManipulator} to adjust the terrain to suit your needs.
data.comment: A container the will fill with Dirt when using a {THING:ItemMiningDrill} when placed inside a {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. You can then use this {SLOT:DirtCanister} with the {THING:ItemTerrainManipulator} to adjust the terrain to suit your needs.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketCargo01_Description
data.value: The cargo module has capacity for two ten-slot crates. You can have multiple cargo modules on your rocket. The rocket can lift up to seven modules in total. This cargo will be released in orbit and descend the surface of your destination. Unless that happens to be the asteroid belt, in which case it will be left floating serenely in the void.
data.comment: The cargo module has capacity for two ten-slot crates. You can have multiple cargo modules on your rocket. The rocket can lift up to seven modules in total. This cargo will be released in orbit and descend the surface of your destination. Unless that happens to be the asteroid belt, in which case it will be left floating serenely in the void.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketCommand01_Description
data.value:
The command module must be placed on top of the rocket, and will assess the rocket’s readiness for flight. Once all conditions are met, the rocket can be launched when all players are seated in the module by pressing ‘IGNITION’ on the console.
The following conditions must be met for launch:
- Fuel full - Fuel mix ratio correct - a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. - All players seated - Power supplied to the {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Fully built rocket
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. When landing, the rocket will deploy a lander, and any cargo contained in the {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01} module.
data.comment:
The command module must be placed on top of the rocket, and will assess the rocket’s readiness for flight. Once all conditions are met, the rocket can be launched when all players are seated in the module by pressing ‘IGNITION’ on the console.
The following conditions must be met for launch:
- Fuel full - Fuel mix ratio correct - a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. - All players seated - Power supplied to the {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Fully built rocket
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. When landing, the rocket will deploy a lander, and any cargo contained in the {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01} module.

data.name: Thing_H2Combustor_Description
data.value: Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
data.comment: Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
