data.name: Thing_ItemAdvancedTablet_Description
data.value:
The advanced {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Padi 2 tablet is an improved version of the basic {THING:ItemTablet}, boasting two {LINK:CartridgePage;cartridge} slots. The Padi 2 accepts {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other cartridges.
With a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} in the {SLOT:ProgrammableChip}, you can access variable slots on the carrying human using the device numbers (d0, d1, etc...), so long as the item can be access via logic, such as the {THING:ItemHardSuit}.
data.comment:
The advanced {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Padi 2 tablet is an improved version of the basic {THING:ItemTablet}, boasting two {LINK:CartridgePage;cartridge} slots. The Padi 2 accepts {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other cartridges.
With a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} in the {SLOT:ProgrammableChip}, you can access variable slots on the carrying human using the device numbers (d0, d1, etc...), so long as the item can be access via logic, such as the {THING:ItemHardSuit}.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitInsulatedPipe_Description
data.value: This kit produces varieties of {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, which greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
data.comment: This kit produces varieties of {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, which greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketEngine01_Description
data.value: The modular rocket engine is capable of lifting up to seven modules, including itself. It must be fueled by at least one {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.
data.comment: The modular rocket engine is capable of lifting up to seven modules, including itself. It must be fueled by at least one {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketFueltank01_Description
data.value:
The rocket fueltank requires a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. If the mixture exceeds these proportions, or you place other {LINK:GasPage;gases} in the tank, the {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console will display an ‘Invalid’ error.
Note that the rocket fueltank can also be used to collect gas mined by the {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}, when connected to that unit by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown}.
data.comment:
The rocket fueltank requires a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. If the mixture exceeds these proportions, or you place other {LINK:GasPage;gases} in the tank, the {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console will display an ‘Invalid’ error.
Note that the rocket fueltank can also be used to collect gas mined by the {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}, when connected to that unit by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown}.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeOrgan_Description
data.value: The pipe organ can be attached to one end of a {THING:ItemPipeValve}. The length of the pipe after the pipe organ changes the pitch of the note it will play when the valve is opened. Use {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} to open and close the valves to create some custom tunes for your base or an audible warning.
data.comment: The pipe organ can be attached to one end of a {THING:ItemPipeValve}. The length of the pipe after the pipe organ changes the pitch of the note it will play when the valve is opened. Use {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} to open and close the valves to create some custom tunes for your base or an audible warning.

data.name: Thing_ItemSensorProcessingUnitOreScanner_Description
data.value: The Sensor Processing unit can be inserted into {THING:ItemSensorLenses} to reveal underground minerals in a HUD.
data.comment: The Sensor Processing unit can be inserted into {THING:ItemSensorLenses} to reveal underground minerals in a HUD.

data.name: Thing_ItemSensorLenses_Description
data.value: These {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} glasses might not be the most fashionable thing, but when a {THING:ItemSensorProcessingUnitOreScanner} is inserted, Stationeers can use these handy glasses to x-ray the ground and find ores that are hidden beneath the surface.
data.comment: These {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} glasses might not be the most fashionable thing, but when a {THING:ItemSensorProcessingUnitOreScanner} is inserted, Stationeers can use these handy glasses to x-ray the ground and find ores that are hidden beneath the surface.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolarPanelFlat_Description
data.value: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight. They lie flat to the ground, and their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
data.comment: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight. They lie flat to the ground, and their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

data.name: Thing_StructureSolarPanel45_Description
data.value: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight, sitting at 45 degrees to the ground. Their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
data.comment: {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight, sitting at 45 degrees to the ground. Their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitSolarPanelBasic_Description
data.value: This kit creates a standing solar panel.
data.comment: This kit creates a standing solar panel.

data.name: Thing_StructureSDBSilo_Description
data.value: The majestic silo holds large quantities of almost anything. While it is doing that, it cannot be deconstructed. Note also, that any food you put into a silo is likely to {LINK:DecayPage;decay} extremely rapidly. The silo can hold up to 600 stacks.
data.comment: The majestic silo holds large quantities of almost anything. While it is doing that, it cannot be deconstructed. Note also, that any food you put into a silo is likely to {LINK:DecayPage;decay} extremely rapidly. The silo can hold up to 600 stacks.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitAirlockGate_Description
data.value: Modular door pieces for creating large hangar doors.
data.comment: Modular door pieces for creating large hangar doors.

data.name: Thing_StructureAirlockGate_Description
data.value: 1 x 1 modular door piece for building hangar doors.
data.comment: 1 x 1 modular door piece for building hangar doors.

data.name: Thing_StructureMediumHangerDoor_Description
data.value: 1 x 2 modular door piece for building hangar doors.
data.comment: 1 x 2 modular door piece for building hangar doors.

data.name: Thing_StructureLargeHangerDoor_Description
data.value: 1 x 3 modular door piece for building hangar doors.
data.comment: 1 x 3 modular door piece for building hangar doors.

data.name: Thing_StructureBatteryLarge_Description
data.value: Providing even better large-scale, reliable power storage than the {THING;StructureBattery}, the {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Da Dianchi' large station battery is the heart of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} bases. There are a variety of cautions to the design of electrical systems using batteries, and every experienced Stationeer has a story to tell, hence the Stationeer adage: 'Dianzi cooks, but it also frys.' {HEADER:POWER OUTPUT} Able to store up to 9000001 watts of power, there are no practical limits to its throughput, hence it is wise to use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Seasoned electrical engineers will also laugh in the face of those who fail to separate out their power generation networks using an {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} and {THING:StructureTransformer}.
data.comment: Providing even better large-scale, reliable power storage than the {THING;StructureBattery}, the {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Da Dianchi' large station battery is the heart of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} bases. There are a variety of cautions to the design of electrical systems using batteries, and every experienced Stationeer has a story to tell, hence the Stationeer adage: 'Dianzi cooks, but it also frys.' {HEADER:POWER OUTPUT} Able to store up to 9000001 watts of power, there are no practical limits to its throughput, hence it is wise to use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Seasoned electrical engineers will also laugh in the face of those who fail to separate out their power generation networks using an {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} and {THING:StructureTransformer}.

data.name: Thing_StructureHarvieReversed_Description
data.value: Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.
data.comment: Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

data.name: Thing_Rover_MkI_Description
data.value: A distant cousin of the jeep, the Mk I {{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} electric rover is one of the most simple and durable light vehicles in the known universe. Able to carry two passengers and cargo such as the {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:Crate}, it is powered by up to three batteries, accepting everything including {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. A quad-array of hub-mounted electric engines propels the reinforced aluminium frame over most terrain and modest obstacles. While the Mk I is designed for stability in low-horizontality circumstances, if it rolls, try using your {THING:ItemCrowbar} to put it right way up.
data.comment: A distant cousin of the jeep, the Mk I {{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} electric rover is one of the most simple and durable light vehicles in the known universe. Able to carry two passengers and cargo such as the {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:Crate}, it is powered by up to three batteries, accepting everything including {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. While the Mk I is designed for stability in low-horizontality circumstances, if it rolls, try using your {THING:ItemCrowbar} to put it right way up.

data.name: Thing_RespawnPoint_Description
data.value: Place a respawn point to set a player entry point to your base when loading in, or returning from the dead.
data.comment: Place a respawn point to set a player entry point to your base when loading in, or returning from the dead.

data.name: Thing_StructureGrowLight_Description
data.value: {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.
data.comment: {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.

data.name: Thing_StructureUprightWindTurbine_Description
data.value: Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
data.comment: Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.

data.name: Thing_CrateMkII_Description
data.value: A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Mk II is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Mk II is about as safe as luggage gets.
data.comment: A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Mk II is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Mk II is about as safe as luggage gets.

data.name: Thing_ItemEmptyCan_Description
data.value: Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.
data.comment: Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

data.name: Thing_ItemPumpkinSoup_Description
data.value: Made using {THING:ItemCookedPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}
data.comment: Made using {THING:ItemCookedPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}

data.name: Thing_ItemCornSoup_Description
data.value: Made using {THING:ItemCookedCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Faily high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.
data.comment: Made using {THING:ItemCookedCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Faily high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

data.name: Thing_ItemBiomass_Description
data.value: Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.
data.comment: Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.

data.name: Thing_StructureHydroponicsTrayData_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with {GAS:Water} using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.
data.comment: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with {GAS:Water} using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.

data.name: Thing_ItemCharcoal_Description
data.value: Charcoal is a lightweight, black carbon residue produced by heating {THING:ItemBiomass} in a {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. It contains less energy potential than {THING:ItemCoalOre}, but can be used as a basic fuel source. Charcoal can also be substituted for coal in {LINK:IngotPage;alloy} recipes.
data.comment: Charcoal is a lightweight, black carbon residue produced by heating {THING:ItemBiomass} in a {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. It contains less energy potential than {THING:ItemCoalOre}, but can be used as a basic fuel source. Charcoal can also be substituted for coal in {LINK:IngotPage;alloy} recipes.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitSolarPanelReinforced_Description
data.value: This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.
data.comment: This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.

data.name: Thing_ItemMiningBeltAdvanced_Description
data.value: The Mk II mining belt is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.
data.comment: The Mk II mining belt is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.

data.name: Thing_StructureWindTurbine_Description
data.value: The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
data.comment: The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitPipeLiquid_Description
data.value: This kit produces a range of liquid pipes.
data.comment: This kit produces a range of liquid pipes.

data.name: Thing_StructurePipeLiquidCrossJunction_Description
data.value: It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
data.comment: It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.

data.name: Thing_ItemWaterBottle_Description
data.value: Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.
data.comment: Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.

data.name: Thing_ItemWaterBottleFiller_Description
data.value: As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.
data.comment: As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.

data.name: Thing_StructureIceCrusher_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective {LINK:GasPage;gases} and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either outlet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.
data.comment: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective {LINK:GasPage;gases} and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either outlet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.

data.name: Thing_DynamicGasTankAdvancedWater_Description
data.value: An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, you are able to store water in this {SLOT:GasCanister} without them gaining or losing temperature.
data.comment: An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, you are able to store water in this {SLOT:GasCanister} without them gaining or losing temperature.

data.name: Thing_StructureLiquidPipeRadiator_Description
data.value: A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added to the liquid within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
data.comment: A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added to the liquid within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.

data.name: Thing_DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater_Description
data.value: An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, for storing liquids without them gaining or losing temperature.
data.comment: An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, for storing liquids without them gaining or losing temperature.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIScrewdriver_Description
data.value: This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definitely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
data.comment: This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definitely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIAngleGrinder_Description
data.value: Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
data.comment: Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIICrowbar_Description
data.value: {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
data.comment: {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIDrill_Description
data.value: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.
data.comment: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIMiningDrill_Description
data.value: The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modeled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.' The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
data.comment: The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modeled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.' The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIWireCutters_Description
data.value: Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.
data.comment: Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIWrench_Description
data.value: One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures} The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
data.comment: One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures} The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

data.name: Thing_ItemMKIIDuctTape_Description
data.value: In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself: put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.
data.comment: In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself: put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

data.name: Thing_StructureRocketModuleSilo_Description
data.value: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous silo module provides storage for {LINK:OrePage;ores} collected by the {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}, {LINK:OrePage;ices} collected by the {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining} and 'space junk' salvaged by the {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining} . In other words, it holds up to 600 'medium-sized dry goods'. The silo module must be connected to a mining or salvage module by a correctly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for material to pass into the silo. The silo module must also be powered when on the launch pad. It is 'on' by default, but can be turned off with logic if needed. The module can also be attached to a {THING:StructureChuteInlet} in order to connect it to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. To extract resources from the silo module, you must set its state to 'OPEN' using logic.
data.comment: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous silo module provides storage for {LINK:OrePage;ores} collected by the {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}, {LINK:OrePage;ices} collected by the {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining} and 'space junk' salvaged by the {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining} . In other words, it holds up to 600 'medium-sized dry goods'. The silo module must be connected to a mining or salvage module by a correctly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for material to pass into the silo. The silo module must also be powered when on the launch pad. It is 'on' by default, but can be turned off with logic if needed. The module can also be attached to a {THING:StructureChuteInlet} in order to connect it to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. To extract resources from the silo module, you must set its state to 'OPEN' using logic.

data.name: Thing_StructureRocketModuleGasCollector_Description
data.value: Collects gas from space by magic.
data.comment: Collects gas from space by magic.

data.name: Thing_StructureRocketModuleEnergyGenerator_Description
data.value: Collects energy by electromagnetically capturing the solar wind. Stores it in the {THING:StructureRocketModuleBattery}. Coming soon
data.comment: Collects energy by electromagnetically capturing the solar wind. Stores it in the {THING:StructureRocketModuleBattery}. Coming soon

data.name: Thing_StructureRocketModuleMiningJunk_Description
data.value: The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.
data.comment: The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

data.name: Thing_StructureRocketModuleMiningOre_Description
data.value: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous {LINK:OrePage;ore} miner harvests metallic ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).
data.comment: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous {LINK:OrePage;ore} miner harvests metallic ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketAutomation_Description
data.value: The automation module completes the rocket. It passes logic to its respective components.
data.comment: The automation module completes the rocket. It passes logic to its respective components.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketCouplingDown_Description
data.value: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed BELOW a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the DOWN coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).
data.comment: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed BELOW a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the DOWN coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketCouplingUp_Description
data.value: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed ABOVE a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the UP coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).
data.comment: A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed ABOVE a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the UP coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketIceMining_Description
data.value: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous ice miner is a purpose-built, robotic ice harvester, able to mine ice ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much ice {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).
data.comment: The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous ice miner is a purpose-built, robotic ice harvester, able to mine ice ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much ice {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketScrapMining_Description
data.value: The so-called {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'space junk' collector module is really a high-end automated salvaging unit, purpose designed to interface with the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous rocket. It sweeps the local region of space for wrecks, abandoned space shipments, and other detritus. As such, it returns a fairly random assortment of items. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.
data.comment: The so-called {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'space junk' collector module is really a high-end automated salvaging unit, purpose designed to interface with the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous rocket. It sweeps the local region of space for wrecks, abandoned space shipments, and other detritus. As such, it returns a fairly random assortment of items. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

data.name: Thing_StructureLiquidDrain_Description
data.value: The drain is a simple device, although not without a touch of mystery. When connected to power and activated, it drains liquid from a liquid network at a rate of 1 mol per tick. Handy if there's liquid you need ... gone.
data.comment: The drain is a simple device, although not without a touch of mystery. When connected to power and activated, it drains liquid from a liquid network at a rate of 1 mol per tick. Handy if there's liquid you need ... gone.

data.name: Thing_StructureModularRocketGasMining_Description
data.value: In typical {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} fashion, the A.R.M. gas mining module is a rapidly designed addition to a more sophisticated system by a company with very little concern for safety or reliability. The module will store mined gas in an empty {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}, so long as it is connected by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}.
data.comment: In typical {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} fashion, the A.R.M. gas mining module is a rapidly designed addition to a more sophisticated system by a company with very little concern for safety or reliability. The module will store mined gas in an empty {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}, so long as it is connected by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}.

data.name: Thing_StructureHeatExchangerLiquidtoLiquid_Description
data.value: The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two liquid networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to liquid management devices like a {THING:StructureLiquidVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two liquid networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to liquid management devices like a {THING:StructureLiquidVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

data.value: The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. data.name: Thing_LogicStepSequencer8_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:ODA;ODA} does not approve of soundtracks or other distractions. As such, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have had to create their own musical accompaniment to the demanding labor of building and maintaining off-world infrastructure. Central to this pastime is the step sequencer, which allows Stationeers to sequence short musical patterns or loops.
{HEADER:DIY MUSIC - GETTING STARTED}
1: Connect 8 {THING:DeviceStepUnit}s to your step sequencer via the data port on the left hand side.
2: Label each step unit, then assign step units 1 through 8 on the step sequencer using the screwdriver.
3: Select the output speaker (eg {THING:PassiveSpeaker}) where the sequencer will play the sounds. This needs to be connected to the logic network on the right hand side of the sequencer.
4: Place a {THING:StopWatch} and use a {THING:StructureLogicReader} and {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write the time to the time variable on the sequencer.
5: Set the BPM on the sequencer using a {THING:StructureLogicDial} and a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write to the sequencer's BPM variable. A higher bpm will play the sequence faster.
6: Insert a sound cartridge of your choosing and select which variant of sound you wish to play by pushing the arrow buttons located above and below the sound cartridge slot.
7: Choose the pitch of the sounds to play by setting the dial on each of your 8 step units to the desired note. With drums, each note is a different drum sounds. You can trial your sounds by pushing the activate button on each step unit (with the sequencer inactive).
8: Get freaky with the {THING:DeviceLfoVolume}.
9: Finally, activate the sequencer, Vibeoneer.
data.comment:
The {LINK:ODA;ODA} does not approve of soundtracks or other distractions. As such, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have had to create their own musical accompaniment to the demanding labor of building and maintaining off-world infrastructure. Central to this pastime is the step sequencer, which allows Stationeers to sequence short musical patterns or loops.
{HEADER:DIY MUSIC - GETTING STARTED}
1: Connect 8 {THING:DeviceStepUnit}s to your step sequencer via the data port on the left hand side.
2: Label each step unit, then assign step units 1 through 8 on the step sequencer using the screwdriver.
3: Select the output speaker (eg {THING:PassiveSpeaker}) where the sequencer will play the sounds. This needs to be connected to the logic network on the right hand side of the sequencer.
4: Place a {THING:StopWatch} and use a {THING:StructureLogicReader} and {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write the time to the time variable on the sequencer.
5: Set the BPM on the sequencer using a {THING:StructureLogicDial} and a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write to the sequencer's BPM variable. A higher bpm will play the sequence faster.
6: Insert a sound cartridge of your choosing and select which variant of sound you wish to play by pushing the arrow buttons located above and below the sound cartridge slot.
7: Choose the pitch of the sounds to play by setting the dial on each of your 8 step units to the desired note. With drums, each note is a different drum sounds. You can trial your sounds by pushing the activate button on each step unit (with the sequencer inactive).
8: Get freaky with the {THING:DeviceLfoVolume}.
9: Finally, activate the sequencer, Vibeoneer.

data.name: Thing_DecayedFood_Description
data.value:
When your {LINK:OrganicPage;food} decays, it turns into this. {LINK:ODA;ODA} scientists have attempted to determine the exact constituents of this substance, but it remains evasive and mysterious. Suffice to say, eating it is a bad idea. Research has determined, however, that The exact speed of decay varies individually by:
- TEMPERATURE - Refrigeration will slow decay, but many foods will be damaged by exposure to extreme low pressure, as well as extreme heat. The optimum temperature is 0 kelvin (-272 C).
- FOOD TYPE - Each {LINK:OrganicPage;food} type has its own decay properties. {THING:ItemTomatoSoup} lasts a lot longer than a {THING:ItemTomato}, for instance.
- PRESSURE - Food decays faster when the pressure drops below 1 atmosphere (101kPa). Decay happens exponentially more quickly as the atmosphere approaches a perfect vacuum. There is no effect from higher pressures.
- ATMOSPHERE - Different gases can slow and accelerate the decay process. The process will take account of respective gas ratios in mixed atmospheres in calculating the decay modifier. The following rates apply across all foods:
> {GAS:Oxygen} x 1.3 > {GAS:Nitrogen} x 0.6 > {GAS:CarbonDioxide} x 0.8 > {GAS:Volatiles} x 1 > {GAS:Pollutant} x 3 > {GAS:NitrousOxide} x 1.5 > {GAS:Steam} x 2 > Vacuum (see PRESSURE above)
data.comment:
When your {LINK:OrganicPage;food} decays, it turns into this. {LINK:ODA;ODA} scientists have attempted to determine the exact constituents of this substance, but it remains evasive and mysterious. Suffice to say, eating it is a bad idea. Research has determined, however, that The exact speed of decay varies individually by:
- TEMPERATURE - Refrigeration will slow decay, but many foods will be damaged by exposure to extreme low pressure, as well as extreme heat. The optimum temperature is 0 kelvin (-272 C).
- FOOD TYPE - Each {LINK:OrganicPage;food} type has its own decay properties. {THING:ItemTomatoSoup} lasts a lot longer than a {THING:ItemTomato}, for instance.
- PRESSURE - Food decays faster when the pressure drops below 1 atmosphere (101kPa). Decay happens exponentially more quickly as the atmosphere approaches a perfect vacuum. There is no effect from higher pressures.
- ATMOSPHERE - Different gases can slow and accelerate the decay process. The process will take account of respective gas ratios in mixed atmospheres in calculating the decay modifier. The following rates apply across all foods:

data.name: Thing_DeviceLfoVolume_Description
data.value:
The low frequency oscillator (or LFO) makes everything sound dark, twisted and crunchy by altering the shape of the waves output by a {THING:LogicStepSequencer8}.
To set up an LFO:
1. Place the LFO unit 2. Set the LFO output to a {THING:PassiveSpeaker} 2. Set a sequencers' output to LFO - so the sequencer's signal runs through the LFO to a speaker. 3. Place a {THING:StopWatch} or use an existing one, then use a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write it to the LFO. 4. Use another logic writer to write the BPM to the LFO. 5. You are ready. This is the future. You're in space. Make it sound cool.
For more info, check out the {LINK:MusicPage;music page}.
data.comment:

For more info, check out the {LINK:MusicPage;music page}.

data.name: Thing_StructureFridgeBig_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Koolaid fridge is a self-cooling storage device with 15 slots that preserves food when powered and turned on. While many users have complained about the placement of the power switch, its place in the pantheon of off-world whiteware is unquestioned.
With its own permanent internal atmosphere, the Koolaid fridge slows the decay of {LINK:OrganicPage;food} by maintaining an optimal internal temperature. Its power usage varies on the external temperature against which it must balance its internal temperature. As such, it must shed heat to operate, so the Koolaid fridge DOES NOT work in a vacuum.
Also, don't leave the door open, as it will equalize with the current world temperature. And maybe start to beep.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.
data.comment:

With its own permanent internal atmosphere, the Koolaid fridge slows the decay of {LINK:OrganicPage;food} by maintaining an optimal internal temperature. Its power usage varies on the external temperature against which it must balance its internal temperature. As such, it must shed heat to operate, so the Koolaid fridge DOES NOT work in a vacuum.

For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.

data.name: Thing_StructureFridgeSmall_Description
data.value:
Essentially a heavily insulated box that allows users to pipe in any desired atmosphere, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} Minibar fridge was a simple solution to the problem of {LINK:NutritionPage;food decay}. It stores a small number of items, at any temperature you can muster.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.

data.name: Thing_StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine_Description
data.value: The refrigerated OmniKool vending machine is an advanced version of the standard {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, which maintains an optimum pressure and constant temperature of -130 degrees C, to prevent food spoilage. It can hold up to 100 stacks. The OmniKool also has an in-built {THING:StructureStacker}, allowing players to set the stack sizes of any items ADDED to the device. The unit's default stack size is 50. NOTE: altering stack sizes DOES NOT update existing stacks within the machine, only those subsequently added.
data.comment: The refrigerated OmniKool vending machine is an advanced version of the standard {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, which maintains an optimum pressure and constant temperature of -130 degrees C, to prevent food spoilage. It can hold up to 100 stacks. The OmniKool also has an in-built {THING:StructureStacker}, allowing players to set the stack sizes of any items ADDED to the device. The unit's default stack size is 50. NOTE: altering stack sizes DOES NOT update existing stacks within the machine, only those subsequently added.

data.name: Thing_Fertilizer_Description
data.value:
Fertilizer alters plant growth processes, and is created by the basic composter and the {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter} using {LINK:OrganicPage;organic} matter. Fertilizer's affects depend on its ingredients:
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for
The effect of these ingredients depends on their respective proportions in the composter when processing is activated.
data.comment:
Fertilizer alters plant growth processes, and is created by the basic composter and the {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter} using {LINK:OrganicPage;organic} matter. Fertilizer's affects depend on its ingredients:
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for
The effect of these ingredients depends on their respective proportions in the composter when processing is activated.

data.name: Thing_StructureAdvancedComposter_Description
data.value:
The advanced composter creates {THING:Fertilizer} out of organic matter. It accepts {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, {THING:DecayedFood} or {THING:ItemBiomass}. It requires {GAS:Water} and power to operate, accelerating the natural composting process. When processing, it releases nitrogen and volatiles, as well a small amount of heat.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for up to five times
data.comment:

data.value: A small planter for decorative or hydroponic purposes. Can be connected to {GAS:Water}, or watered manually using a {THING:ItemWaterBottle} or {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater}.

data.name: Thing_PortableComposter_Description
data.value:
A simple composting device, the basic composter creates {THING:Fertilizer} out of organic matter. It accepts {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, {THING:DecayedFood} or {THING:ItemBiomass}. It requires a full {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty} and a battery to operate, accelerating the natural composting process. When processing, it releases nitrogen and volatiles, as well a small amount of heat.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.

data.name: Thing_AppliancePackagingMachine_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Cannifier requires {THING:ItemEmptyCan} and cooked {LINK:OrganicPage;food} to create {LINK:DecayPage;long-lasting}, easily stored sustenance. Note that the Cannifier must be bolted to a {THING:StructureBench} for power, and only accepts cooked food and tin cans.
{HEADER:OPERATION}
1. Add the correct ingredients to the device via the hopper in the TOP.
2. Close the device using the dropdown handle.
3. Activate the device.
4. Remove canned goods from the outlet in the FRONT.
Note: the Cannifier will flash an error on its activation switch if you attempt to activate it before closing it.
data.comment:
The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Cannifier requires {THING:ItemEmptyCan} and cooked {LINK:OrganicPage;food} to create {LINK:DecayPage;long-lasting}, easily stored sustenance. Note that the Cannifier must be bolted to a {THING:StructureBench} for power, and only accepts cooked food and tin cans.
{HEADER:OPERATION}
1. Add the correct ingredients to the device via the hopper in the TOP.
2. Close the device using the dropdown handle.
3. Activate the device.
4. Remove canned goods from the outlet in the FRONT.
Note: the Cannifier will flash an error on its activation switch if you attempt to activate it before closing it.

data.name: Thing_StructureHorizontalAutoMiner_Description
data.value:
The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} OGRE (Orthogonal Ground Rotating Excavator) is a base structure with attached mining vehicle, which will mine a horizontal shaft up to X meters long. When full, the mining vehicle will return to the base to empty itself, before returning to dig. If it encounters empty space, it will also return to base and await instruction. The unit will return if deactivated.
The OGRE can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the OGRE outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area, due to more efficient processing.
{HEADER:MODES} Idle - 0 Mining - 1 Returning - 2 DepostingOre - 3 Finished - 4
data.comment:
The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} OGRE (Orthogonal Ground Rotating Excavator) is a base structure with attached mining vehicle, which will mine a horizontal shaft up to X meters long. When full, the mining vehicle will return to the base to empty itself, before returning to dig. If it encounters empty space, it will also return to base and await instruction. The unit will return if deactivated.
The OGRE can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the OGRE outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area, due to more efficient processing.
{HEADER:MODES} Idle - 0 Mining - 1 Returning - 2 DepostingOre - 3 Finished - 4

data.name: Thing_ItemLaptop_Description
data.value:
The Laptop functions as a portable IC editor. To operate the Laptop it must be powered with a battery, have a {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip} in the motherboard slot, and an {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} in the Programmable Chip Slot.
You must place the laptop down to interact with the onsreen UI.
data.comment:
The Laptop functions as a portable IC editor. To operate the Laptop it must be powered with a battery, have a {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip} in the motherboard slot, and an {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} in the Programmable Chip Slot.
You must place the laptop down to interact with the onsreen UI.

data.name: Thing_ItemPlantEndothermic_Genepool1_Description
data.value: {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalog of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings, when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The alpha variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 90Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 0 to 40 Degrees Celsius.
data.comment: {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalog of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings, when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The alpha variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 90Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 0 to 40 Degrees Celsius.

data.name: Thing_ItemPlantThermogenic_Genepool1_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}.
data.comment: The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}.

data.name: Thing_ItemPlantThermogenic_Genepool2_Description

data.name: Thing_StructureStirlingEngine_Description
data.value:
Harnessing an ancient thermal exploit, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Libra' Stirling Engine generates power via the expansion and contraction of a working gas to drive pistons operating an electrical generator.
When high pressure hot gas is supplied into the input pipe, this gas will heat the hot side of the unit, then pass into the output pipe. The cooler side uses the room's ambient atmosphere, which must be kept at a lower temperature and pressure in order to create a differential. Add a working gas by inserting a {SLOT:GasCanister}. The unit must be deactivated when adding or removing canisters, or the working gas may leak into the surrounding atmosphere.
Gases with a low molecular mass make the most efficient working gases. Increasing the moles of working gas can result in a greater potential power output. However, overpressuring the unit may have ... sub-optimal results.
data.comment:
Harnessing an ancient thermal exploit, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Libra' Stirling Engine generates power via the expansion and contraction of a working gas to drive pistons operating an electrical generator.
When high pressure hot gas is supplied into the input pipe, this gas will heat the hot side of the unit, then pass into the output pipe. The cooler side uses the room's ambient atmosphere, which must be kept at a lower temperature and pressure in order to create a differential. Add a working gas by inserting a {SLOT:GasCanister}. The unit must be deactivated when adding or removing canisters, or the working gas may leak into the surrounding atmosphere.
Gases with a low molecular mass make the most efficient working gases. Increasing the moles of working gas can result in a greater potential power output. However, overpressuring the unit may have ... sub-optimal results.

data.name: Thing_StructurePowerTransmitter_Description
data.value: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. The transmitter must be aligned to the base station in order to transmit any power. The brightness of the transmitter's collimator arc provides an indication of transmission intensity. Note that there is an attrition over longer ranges, so the unit requires more power over greater distances to deliver the same output.
data.comment: The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. data.name: Thing_StructureLargeExtendableRadiator_Description
data.value: Omptimised for radiating heat in vacuum and low pressure environments. If pointed at the sun it will heat its contents rapidly via solar heating. The panels can fold away to stop all heat radiation/solar heating and protect them from storms.
data.comment: Omptimised for radiating heat in vacuum and low pressure environments. If pointed at the sun it will heat its contents rapidly via solar heating. The panels can fold away to stop all heat radiation/solar heating and protect them from storms.

data.name: Thing_ItemNitrice_Description
data.value:
Nitrice is the nickname given to solid {GAS:Nitrogen} Ice, and found on many planets and moons in the Solar System. Given the inert nature of the {GAS:Nitrogen} it produces, the ice is useful when making breathable atmospheres with low flammability.
Highly sensitive to temperature, nitrice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.
data.comment:
Nitrice is the nickname given to solid {GAS:Nitrogen} Ice, and found on many planets and moons in the Solar System. Given the inert nature of the {GAS:Nitrogen} it produces, the ice is useful when making breathable atmospheres with low flammability.
Highly sensitive to temperature, nitrice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.

data.name: Thing_StructureLogicGate_Description
data.value: A {LINK:LogicPage;logic} device that performs a logical operation on one or more binary inputs that produces a single binary output. An input greater than zero is considered true for operations.
data.comment: A {LINK:LogicPage;logic} device that performs a logical operation on one or more binary inputs that produces a single binary output. An input greater than zero is considered true for operations.

data.name: Thing_StructureNitrolyzer_Description
data.value: This device is used to create {GAS:NitrousOxide} from {GAS:Oxygen}, {GAS:Nitrogen}, and a large amount of energy. The process does not completely transform all the available gas at once, so the output is a mix of all three gasses, which may need further processing. More NOS will be created, if the gas inside the machine is close to a 1/1 ratio of Oxygen to Nitrogen. The second gas input line in optional, and not required if the gas is pre mixed.
data.comment: This device is used to create {GAS:NitrousOxide} from {GAS:Oxygen}, {GAS:Nitrogen}, and a large amount of energy. The process does not completely transform all the available gas at once, so the output is a mix of all three gasses, which may need further processing. More NOS will be created, if the gas inside the machine is close to a 1/1 ratio of Oxygen to Nitrogen. The second gas input line in optional, and not required if the gas is pre mixed.

data.name: Thing_StructureH2Combustor_Description
data.value: Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
data.comment: Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.

data.name: Thing_StructureProximitySensor_Description
data.value: Will be triggered if there is a player in the range of the sensor (as defined by the setting dial). The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can configure the sensor to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}.

data.name: Thing_StructureOccupancySensor_Description
data.value: Will be triggered if there is a player in the same room as the sensor. The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can use configure it to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}. This sensor only works when placed in a room.

data.name: Thing_ItemDirtyOre_Description

data.value: A chute that toggles between two outputs
data.comment: A chute that toggles between two outputs

data.name: Thing_StructureChuteValve_Description
data.value: The Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute.
data.comment: The Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute.

data.name: Thing_StructureCombustionCentrifuge_Description
data.value: The Combustion Centrifuge is a gas powered version of the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. A combustible fuel mix should be supplied to the gas input, and waste gasses should be vented from the output. The machine's RPMs must be controlled via the throttle and combustion limiter levers. If the Combustion Centrifuge gains, or looses, RPMs too fast it will experience stress, and eventually grind to a halt. Higher RPMs directly result in faster processing speeds. The throttle lever controls the amount of fuel being pulled into the machine, increasing the temperature inside the engine, and leading to an increase in RPM. The limiter lever influences the speed of the combustion, and how much uncombusted gas is in the exhaust. Ejecting ore from the Combustion Centrifuge while it is at high RPMs will result in additional stress build up. If turned off while not stressed, the machine will automatically start to brake, and reduce RPMs in a controlled manner.
data.comment: The Combustion Centrifuge is a gas powered version of the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. A combustible fuel mix should be supplied to the gas input, and waste gasses should be vented from the output. The machine's RPMs must be controlled via the throttle and combustion limiter levers. If the Combustion Centrifuge gains, or looses, RPMs too fast it will experience stress, and eventually grind to a halt. Higher RPMs directly result in faster processing speeds. The throttle lever controls the amount of fuel being pulled into the machine, increasing the temperature inside the engine, and leading to an increase in RPM. The limiter lever influences the speed of the combustion, and how much uncombusted gas is in the exhaust. Ejecting ore from the Combustion Centrifuge while it is at high RPMs will result in additional stress build up. If turned off while not stressed, the machine will automatically start to brake, and reduce RPMs in a controlled manner.

data.comment: The digital flip flop will toggle between two outputs using a specified ratio (n:1). For example, setting the dial to 2 would allow two items to pass through the primary output before flipping to the secondary output.

data.name: Thing_ItemKitStandardChute_Description
data.value: This kit produces a variety of powered chutes
data.comment: This kit produces a variety of powered chutes

data.name: Thing_ItemPlantSampler_Description
data.value: The Plant Sampler allows you to take a {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} sample of a growing plant. The sampler can then be placed in the {THING:AppliancePlantGeneticAnalyzer} to attain and interpret the results.
data.comment: The Plant Sampler allows you to take a {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} sample of a growing plant. The sampler can then be placed in the {THING:AppliancePlantGeneticAnalyzer} to attain and interpret the results.

data.name: Thing_AppliancePlantGeneticAnalyzer_Description
data.value:
The Genetic Analyzer can be used to process samples from the {THING:ItemPlantSampler}. Once processed, the genetic information of the sampled plant can be viewed by clicking on the search button.
Individual Gene Value Widgets: Most gene values will appear as a sliding bar between a minimum value on the left and a maximum value on the right. The actual value of the gene is in the middle of the bar, in orange.
Multiple Gene Value Widgets: For temperature and pressure ranges, four genes appear on the same widget. The orange values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for growth. Outside of this range, the plant will stop growing and eventually die. The blue values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for ideal growth. Inside of this range, the plant will grow at maximum speed. The white values above the bar are the minimum and maximum achievable values for the growth threshold.
data.comment:
The Genetic Analyzer can be used to process samples from the {THING:ItemPlantSampler}. Once processed, the genetic information of the sampled plant can be viewed by clicking on the search button.
Individual Gene Value Widgets: Most gene values will appear as a sliding bar between a minimum value on the left and a maximum value on the right. The actual value of the gene is in the middle of the bar, in orange.
Multiple Gene Value Widgets: For temperature and pressure ranges, four genes appear on the same widget. The orange values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for growth. Outside of this range, the plant will stop growing and eventually die. The blue values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for ideal growth. Inside of this range, the plant will grow at maximum speed. The white values above the bar are the minimum and maximum achievable values for the growth threshold.

data.name: Thing_AppliancePlantGeneticStabilizer_Description
data.value: The Genetic Stabilizer can be used to manipulate gene stability on a specific {LINK:OrganicPage;Plants} or {LINK:OrganicPage;Seeds}. It has two modes Stabilize and Destabilize. Stabilize: Increases all genes stability by 50%. Destabilize: Decreases all gene stability by 10% other than a chosen gene which will received decreased stability by 50%.
data.comment: The Genetic Stabilizer can be used to manipulate gene stability on a specific {LINK:OrganicPage;Plants} or {LINK:OrganicPage;Seeds}. It has two modes Stabilize and Destabilize. Stabilize: Increases all genes stability by 50%. Destabilize: Decreases all gene stability by 10% other than a chosen gene which will received decreased stability by 50%.

data.name: Thing_AppliancePlantGeneticSplicer_Description
data.value:
The Genetic Splicer can be used to copy a single {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} from one 'source' plant to another 'target' plant of the same type. After copying, the source plant will be destroyed.
To begin splicing, place a plant or seed bag in the left slot (source) and place another plant or seed bag of the same type in the right slot (target). You can select a gene using the arrow buttons. Close the sliding door and press the green activate button. Once splicing has begun, the device will be locked until the process has finished (which will take approximately twenty minutes). If you want to cancel splicing you can power off the bench or detach the appliance as a last resort.
data.comment:
The Genetic Splicer can be used to copy a single {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} from one 'source' plant to another 'target' plant of the same type. After copying, the source plant will be destroyed.
To begin splicing, place a plant or seed bag in the left slot (source) and place another plant or seed bag of the same type in the right slot (target). You can select a gene using the arrow buttons. Close the sliding door and press the green activate button. Once splicing has begun, the device will be locked until the process has finished (which will take approximately twenty minutes). If you want to cancel splicing you can power off the bench or detach the appliance as a last resort.

data.name: Thing_ApplianceSeedTray_Description
data.value: The seed tray can hold up to twelve plants or seeds and can be used to facilitate fast experimentation and testing of plant genetics.
data.comment: The seed tray can hold up to twelve plants or seeds and can be used to facilitate fast experimentation and testing of plant genetics.

data.name: Thing_Landingpad_CenterPiece01_Description

data.comment: The target point where the trader shuttle will land. Requires a clear view of the sky.

data.comment: Provides power to the landing pad. The data port must be connected to the data port of a computer with a communications motherboard for a trader to be called in to land.

data.comment: Increases the volume of the landing pads gas storage capacity. This volume is used for buying and selling gas to traders.

data.name: Thing_Landingpad_GasConnectorOutwardPiece_Description

data.comment: Pumps gas purchased from a trader out of the landing pad. You can increase the landing pad's gas storage capacity by adding more {THING:Landingpad_GasCylinderTankPiece} to the landing pad.

data.name: Thing_Landingpad_LiquidConnectorOutwardPiece_Description

data.comment: Pumps liquid purchased from a trader out of the landing pad. You can increase the landing pad's liquid storage capacity by adding more {THING:Landingpad_GasCylinderTankPiece} to the landing pad.

data.name: Thing_StructureSmallSatelliteDish_Description
data.value:
This small communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.
data.comment:
This small communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.

data.name: Thing_LiquidRocketEngineBasic_Description
data.value: A small liquid fueled rocket engine with an electric TurboPump. The Liquid input should be supplied with fuel mix of volatiles and oxygen. It has a thrust range of around 6kN to 30kN and an expected Isp of 230s (exhaust velocity: 2.2km/s).

data.name: Interface_LoulanShortDesc
data.value: Loulan, upon arrival you will notice a breathable atmosphere, high enough pressure to sustain life - but a severe lack of it. This sandy giant is situated in the Gargantuan System, moving closer to the black hole situated in the center each day. While abandoned and no longer green and full of {GAS:Water}, this planet still has a functioning atmosphere and you are tasked with scouring the wasteland to acquire the materials and resources needed to survive on this everlasting desert.
data.comment: Loulan, upon arrival you will notice a breathable atmosphere, high enough pressure to sustain life - but a severe lack of it. This sandy giant is situated in the Gargantuan System, moving closer to the black hole situated in the center each day. While abandoned and no longer green and full of {GAS:Water}, this planet still has a functioning atmosphere and you are tasked with scouring the wasteland to acquire the materials and resources needed to survive on this everlasting desert.
