data.name: Interface_NewWorldMoonDesc
data.value: So you're stuck on the moon, but it's not all bad.Sure, it's cold, harsh and pretty monotonous, but at least the sun's shining. The solar panel is going to be useful, and the power controller... and probably the arc furnace too. There's even a little food and oxygen in the other crates, though it's definitely not going to last forever. Neither's your battery. You better start thinking about how you're going to survive. How hard could it be to rig up an airlock? A generator? Maybe even smelt some ore and build yourself a base? Looks like you're gonna be here a while.
data.comment: So you're stuck on the moon, but it's not all bad.Sure, it's cold, harsh and pretty monotonous, but at least the sun's shining. The solar panel is going to be useful, and the power controller... and probably the arc furnace too. There's even a little food and oxygen in the other crates, though it's definitely not going to last forever. Neither's your battery. You better start thinking about how you're going to survive. How hard could it be to rig up an airlock? A generator? Maybe even smelt some ore and build yourself a base? Looks like you're gonna be here a while.

data.name: Interface_NewWorldSpaceDesc
data.value: This is Stationeers Creative Mode!Spawn in any item, test ideas and build bonkers stuff real fast. <color=red>This mode is experimental. Think of it as a freeform space party where exciting and unexpected things* can and will happen, compared to the more reliable near-death experience of Survival Mode. Just don't be sad when you blow yourself into tiny, tiny little pieces or get savaged by chickens or slowly explode while drifting alone into the infinite void. *bugs
data.comment: This is Stationeers Creative Mode!Spawn in any item, test ideas and build bonkers stuff real fast. <color=red>This mode is experimental. Think of it as a freeform space party where exciting and unexpected things* can and will happen, compared to the more reliable near-death experience of Survival Mode. Just don't be sad when you blow yourself into tiny, tiny little pieces or get savaged by chickens or slowly explode while drifting alone into the infinite void. *bugs

data.name: Interface_NewWorldMarsShortDesc
data.value: A desolate dusty red ball, Mars features more varied terrain that can reach into the sky, and a chilly atmosphere that's no good for breathing, but maybe it can be used for something ...
data.comment: A desolate dusty red ball, Mars features more varied terrain that can reach into the sky, and a chilly atmosphere that's no good for breathing, but maybe it can be used for something ...

data.name: Interface_NewWorldMoonShortDesc
data.value: While the presence of coal isn't typical of Earth's Moon, the relatively flat terrain full of various sizable craters and lack of atmosphere may be more familiar in this grey landscape. A great location for the budding Stationeer to begin their journey, with fewer of the hazards and complexities offered on more exotic worlds
data.comment: While the presence of coal isn't typical of Earth's Moon, the relatively flat terrain full of various sizable craters and lack of atmosphere may be more familiar in this grey landscape. A great location for the budding Stationeer to begin their journey, with fewer of the hazards and complexities offered on more exotic worlds

data.name: Interface_NewWorldSpaceShortDesc
data.value: While there's no gravity or atmosphere, at least there's a lot of space to build! You'll find yourself among several asteroids that may contain various ores and ices you can use to survive out here.
data.comment: While there's no gravity or atmosphere, at least there's a lot of space to build! You'll find yourself among several asteroids that may contain various ores and ices you can use to survive out here.

data.name: Interface_NewWorldVenusShortDesc
data.value: Unvarying extreme temperatures and ultra-high pressures make Venus no place for the faint-hearted. Only the most accomplished Stationeers will survive on our once-sister planet, now a barren rock. Dig deep, or go home.
data.comment: Unvarying extreme temperatures and ultra-high pressures make Venus no place for the faint-hearted. Only the most accomplished Stationeers will survive on our once-sister planet, now a barren rock. Dig deep, or go home.

data.name: Interface_NewWorldEuropaShortDesc
data.value: Melting some of the ice on this cold world has finally given it an atmosphere, but it's extremely frigid environment presents a serious challenge for the stationeers.The extreme cold will cause batteries to rapidly lose power, so getting a steady power source and warm location are your priorities.
data.comment: Melting some of the ice on this cold world has finally given it an atmosphere, but it's extremely frigid environment presents a serious challenge for the stationeers.The extreme cold will cause batteries to rapidly lose power, so getting a steady power source and warm location are your priorities.

data.name: Interface_NewWorldVulcanShortDesc
data.value: The volatile environment on Vulcan is surviable for very few living organisms, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.
data.comment: The volatile environment on Vulcan is surviable for very few living organisms, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.

data.name: Interface_NewWorldVulcan2ShortDesc
data.value: A world torn apart due to massive tidal forces from the supermassive black hole it orbits. Vulcan offers little hope for any organism that ends up here, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.Watch out for the deep crevasses that lead to deadly magma flows beneath the surface!
data.comment: A world torn apart due to massive tidal forces from the supermassive black hole it orbits. Vulcan offers little hope for any organism that ends up here, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.Watch out for the deep crevasses that lead to deadly magma flows beneath the surface!

data.name: Interface_NewWorldMimasShortDesc
data.value: A barren rock nestled under the wing of Saturn's spectacular rings. Mimas tiny stature is reflected in its extremely low gravity, and the Mimantean surface is saturated with impact craters from wayward ring occupants. It's distance from the sun provides little power from solar devices.Be very careful when walking or jumping, as you can travel a long way and gain a lot of speed due to the extremely low gravity.
data.comment: A barren rock nestled under the wing of Saturn's spectacular rings. Mimas tiny stature is reflected in its extremely low gravity, and the Mimantean surface is saturated with impact craters from wayward ring occupants. It's distance from the sun provides little power from solar devices.Be very careful when walking or jumping, as you can travel a long way and gain a lot of speed due to the extremely low gravity.

data.value: Please visit the control assignment window and clear conflicts
data.comment: Please visit the control assignment window and clear conflicts

data.name: Interface_LogicTypeColor
data.value:
Whether driven by concerns for clarity, safety or simple aesthetics, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have access to a small rainbow of colors for their constructions. These are the color setting for devices, represented as an integer.
0: Blue 1: Grey 2: Green 3: Orange 4: Red 5: Yellow 6: White 7: Black 8: Brown 9: Khaki 10: Pink 11: Purple
It is an unwavering universal law that anything higher than 11 will be purple. The {LINK:ODA;ODA} is powerless to change this. Similarly, anything lower than 0 will be Blue.
data.comment:
Whether driven by concerns for clarity, safety or simple aesthetics, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have access to a small rainbow of colors for their constructions. These are the color setting for devices, represented as an integer.
0: Blue 1: Grey 2: Green 3: Orange 4: Red 5: Yellow 6: White 7: Black 8: Brown 9: Khaki 10: Pink 11: Purple
It is an unwavering universal law that anything higher than 11 will be purple. The {LINK:ODA;ODA} is powerless to change this. Similarly, anything lower than 0 will be Blue.

data.name: Interface_ScriptCommandLB

data.comment: Loads LogicType from all output network devices with provided type hash using the provide batch mode. Average (0), Sum (1), Minimum (2), Maximum (3). Can use either the word, or the number.

data.name: Interface_ScriptCommandLBN

data.comment: Loads LogicType from all output network devices with provided type and name hashes using the provide batch mode. Average (0), Sum (1), Minimum (2), Maximum (3). Can use either the word, or the number.

data.name: Interface_ScriptCommandLBS

data.comment: Loads LogicSlotType from slotIndex from all output network devices with provided type hash using the provide batch mode. Average (0), Sum (1), Minimum (2), Maximum (3). Can use either the word, or the number.

data.name: Interface_ScriptCommandLBNS

data.comment: Loads LogicSlotType from slotIndex from all output network devices with provided type and name hashes using the provide batch mode. Average (0), Sum (1), Minimum (2), Maximum (3). Can use either the word, or the number.

data.name: Interface_AgrizeroDesc
data.value: Agrizero is an agricultural biotech firm focused on researching and deploying offworld farming technology. The company’s aim is to provide a network of self-sustaining, self-contained 'bio-factories' that will ultimately feed a projected 1 million humans in space. Emerging from the late 21st century's environmental disasters, the firm has roots in China's world-saving artificial farming initiatives, and has now spread to facilities in the Asteroid Belt, where the supply of ice asteroids makes vertical farming and controlled-environment agriculture extremely promising. While many of their facilities are still under construction, Agrizero is already one of the main suppliers of offworld groups like {LINK:ODA;ODA}, {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} and {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} through the ever-expanding Trader Network.
data.comment: Agrizero is an agricultural biotech firm focused on researching and deploying offworld farming technology. The company’s aim is to provide a network of self-sustaining, self-contained 'bio-factories' that will ultimately feed a projected 1 million humans in space. Emerging from the late 21st century's environmental disasters, the firm has roots in China's world-saving artificial farming initiatives, and has now spread to facilities in the Asteroid Belt, where the supply of ice asteroids makes vertical farming and controlled-environment agriculture extremely promising. While many of their facilities are still under construction, Agrizero is already one of the main suppliers of offworld groups like {LINK:ODA;ODA}, {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} and {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} through the ever-expanding Trader Network.

data.name: Interface_AsuraDesc
data.value: Asura Biomedia was founded in the early 22nd century by Mumbai-based trillionaire Ashan Gurwaja. Nominally focused on 'biotechnology', the company has always had an ‘elastic’ notion of exactly what that entailed: everything from pharmaceuticals to pet food. Gurwaja's background in bio-engineering firms put the company in the highest echelon of bio-science industries from the very beginning, and it grew exactly as its founder intended: rapidly and reliably, structured specifically to swallow up any smaller firms in its way. Near mid-century, Asura's ambitions evolved to embrace entire health systems – it is now the largest provider of healthcare on Earth, integrating hospitals and primary care with medical supplies, pharmaceutical production and retail, residential care and funeral services. By 2150, Asura's business was a simple proposition, as captured in their famous – if not infamous – advertising slogan: 'We're in you'.
data.comment: Asura Biomedia was founded in the early 22nd century by Mumbai-based trillionaire Ashan Gurwaja. Nominally focused on 'biotechnology', the company has always had an ‘elastic’ notion of exactly what that entailed: everything from pharmaceuticals to pet food. Near mid-century, Asura's ambitions evolved to embrace entire health systems – it is now the largest provider of healthcare on Earth, integrating hospitals and primary care with medical supplies, pharmaceutical production and retail, residential care and funeral services. By 2150, Asura's business was a simple proposition, as captured in their famous – if not infamous – advertising slogan: 'We're in you'.

data.name: Interface_CHACDesc
data.value: Founded in 2085 to produce weapons for {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}'s space forces, the company is known for making highly reliable and affordable weapons for off-world use. Their pragmatic approach is reflected in their focus on designs suitable for 3D printing and mass production, as well as a high reuse of components across models and weapon classes. As a result, although CHAC guns excel in no particular category, and have certainly never been accused of gretness, they suffer no great failings, and perform sufficiently well by most known measures to have earned their designers the informal title of 'armorer to the Solar System'.
data.comment: Founded in 2085 to produce weapons for {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}'s space forces, the company is known for making highly reliable and affordable weapons for off-world use. Their pragmatic approach is reflected in their focus on designs suitable for 3D printing and mass production, as well as a high reuse of components across models and weapon classes. As a result, although CHAC guns excel in no particular category, and have certainly never been accused of gretness, they suffer no great failings, and perform sufficiently well by most known measures to have earned their designers the informal title of 'armorer to the Solar System'.

data.name: Interface_ExMinDesc
data.value: In the aftermath of the Sisyphus disaster on Mars in 2079, asteroid shifting was officially banned by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}. This sea-change forced the newborn space mining industry to reconsider its strategies, but until the opening of the Manaus Space Elevator, marginal economics meant offworld resource extraction was effectively impossible. Formed in 2095 by a long-standing Swiss-German mining conglomerate and a consortium of other interests, ExMin was more an idea than a commercial reality for several decades. Created with the certainty that a space elevator would eventually arrive, ExMin was one of the first to exploit the access it offered. Subsequently it has become one of the Solar System's most powerful commercial entities. With access to space secure, ExMin became a central player in the flow of resources to the Inner System. It has competition, principally from Brazilian mining giant {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, but the company has never entirely lost its lead on off-world mining. Synonymous with rare earth metals and pioneering off-world resource extraction, it stands at the forefront of development throughout the Solar System.
data.comment: In the aftermath of the Sisyphus disaster on Mars in 2079, asteroid shifting was officially banned by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}. This sea-change forced the newborn space mining industry to reconsider its strategies, but until the opening of the Manaus Space Elevator, marginal economics meant offworld resource extraction was effectively impossible. Synonymous with rare earth metals and pioneering off-world resource extraction, it stands at the forefront of development throughout the Solar System.

data.name: Interface_GeFabrikDesc
data.value: Officially known as Gewehrfabrik GmbH, GeFabrik is one of the world’s oldest and most highly regarded armament firms, known for producing exceptionally accurate, high-end firearms. In the wake of the European arms manufacturing collapse in the 2030s, a group of unemployed armament staff formed GeFabrik. Dedicated to renewing original design principles, the company is legendary for extensive testing, sometimes lasting as long as 10 years, in order to produce ‘ganz’ weapon formats. GeFabrik is widely regarded as having single-handedly salvaged Germany's manufacturing reputation, while doing nothing for their sense of humor.
data.comment: Officially known as Gewehrfabrik GmbH, GeFabrik is one of the world’s oldest and most highly regarded armament firms, known for producing exceptionally accurate, high-end firearms. In the wake of the European arms manufacturing collapse in the 2030s, a group of unemployed armament staff formed GeFabrik. Dedicated to renewing original design principles, the company is legendary for extensive testing, sometimes lasting as long as 10 years, in order to produce ‘ganz’ weapon formats. GeFabrik is widely regarded as having single-handedly salvaged Germany's manufacturing reputation, while doing nothing for their sense of humor.

data.name: Interface_HiiragiDesc
data.value: Founded by Noboru Hiiragi in the aftermath of the 2110s economic bubble, Hiiragi Communications absorbed several prominent offworld assets, quickly becoming the most widely used trans-Solar System communications network. If you’ve communicated with friends and family offworld recently, it’s been through the Hiiragi network, even if it’s been branded under one of its many child companies. Hiiragi is also the number one seller for PCD’s (Personal Communication Devices) as well as a deep, if difficult to assess investor in terrestrial telecommunication networks.
data.comment: Founded by Noboru Hiiragi in the aftermath of the 2110s economic bubble, Hiiragi Communications absorbed several prominent offworld assets, quickly becoming the most widely used trans-Solar System communications network. Hiiragi is also the number one seller for PCD’s (Personal Communication Devices) as well as a deep, if difficult to assess investor in terrestrial telecommunication networks.

data.name: Interface_NorsecDesc
data.value: With its roots in early 20th Century defense industry, Norsec (a.k.a. Northern Security Systems) was an early adopter of asteroid mining – one of its tugs being involved in the infamous Sisyphus Hit on the fledgling Martian colony at Sanders. Norsec was officially cleared of any wrong-doing, but when the {LINK:ODA;ODA} banned asteroidal relocation, the company shifted its focus to infrastructure and manufacturing. Norsec’s orbitally-based Space Systems Division is responsible for the design and production of {LINK:ODA;ODA}’s core transport systems, while also being rumoured to hold a large interest in {LINK:ExMin;ExMin}. The company is also noted for its willingness to engage in experimental robotic technology.

Norsec was officially cleared of any wrong-doing, but when the {LINK:ODA;ODA} banned asteroidal relocation, the company shifted its focus to infrastructure and manufacturing. Norsec’s orbitally-based Space Systems Division is responsible for the design and production of {LINK:ODA;ODA}’s core transport systems, while also being rumoured to hold a large interest in {LINK:ExMin;ExMin}. The company is also noted for its willingness to engage in experimental robotic technology.

data.name: Interface_ODADesc
data.value: In the aftermath of the Earth Crisis, humanity’s focus on space diminished. Yet many felt that, without ambitions beyond our home planet, our species might falter. Created in 2070CE by a newly revamped United Nations, the Offworld Development Agency was given a very specific goal - to guide and encourage human space exploration at a time the cosmos was fading from the public mind. It inaugurated the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} Program in 2095. Understanding that funding would be difficult to come by, the ODA conceived the program as a slow-burn, low-outlay space initiative. While some derided Stationeers as 'cut-price cosmic castaways', the success of the program is testament to the wisdom and pragmatism of ODA's vision.
data.comment: In the aftermath of the Earth Crisis, humanity’s focus on space diminished. Yet many felt that, without ambitions beyond our home planet, our species might falter. Created in 2070CE by a newly revamped United Nations, the Offworld Development Agency was given a very specific goal - to guide and encourage human space exploration at a time the cosmos was fading from the public mind. It inaugurated the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} Program in 2095. Understanding that funding would be difficult to come by, the ODA conceived the program as a slow-burn, low-outlay space initiative. While some derided Stationeers as 'cut-price cosmic castaways', the success of the program is testament to the wisdom and pragmatism of ODA's vision.

data.name: Interface_RecursoDesc
data.value: This long-standing Brazilian mining group branched into space in the late 21st century. Focused primarily on bulk minerals and metals, the company is perhaps best understood as an extension of the Brazilian government – very few upper echelon political figures in modern Brazil are not implicated in one arm or another of this industrial behemoth. Enmeshment with South American politics has given the company heavy influence over the Manaus space elevator. This deep state control has led to other groups – the {LINK:ODA;ODA} included – to exercise a certain ‘flexibility’ toward Recurso. Accusations of illegal asteroid relocation, safety violations and numerous commercial infringements have barely touched it. Meanwhile, defenders point out that very little has been proven in court, and Recurso is hardly alone – hence the truism: 'In space, we all live in glass houses.'
data.comment: This long-standing Brazilian mining group branched into space in the late 21st century. Focused primarily on bulk minerals and metals, the company is perhaps best understood as an extension of the Brazilian government – very few upper echelon political figures in modern Brazil are not implicated in one arm or another of this industrial behemoth. Enmeshment with South American politics has given the company heavy influence over the Manaus space elevator. This deep state control has led to other groups – the {LINK:ODA;ODA} included – to exercise a certain ‘flexibility’ toward Recurso. Accusations of illegal asteroid relocation, safety violations and numerous commercial infringements have barely touched it. Meanwhile, defenders point out that very little has been proven in court, and Recurso is hardly alone – hence the truism: 'In space, we all live in glass houses.'

data.name: Interface_SinotaiDesc
data.value: The sole 'traditional' state entity to survive offworld politics, Sinotai’s reach and power is second only to the {LINK:ODA;ODA} itself. In many ways a relic – a sub-agency of a staggeringly complicated Earth-bound corporate-bureaucracy – its structure has allowed Sinotai to achieve incredible things. Proving its mettle in the early 21st Century by putting the first humans on Mars, establishing the first offworld gigawatt power system, and the first space-borne fuel refinery, few space-going organisations lack some degree of relationship with Sinotai. A common joke has it that it's impossible to do anything in space without them. Regardless of the truth, Sinotai's approach to off-world development has involved a 'soft power' approach, from MOU's with {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} (giving them preferential access to the Manaus space elevator) to murkier alliances of convenience with a range of Trader groups.

data.name: Interface_TKDesc
data.value: Originally a defense contractor specializing in brute force, high power weaponry, Tanzanian Kinetic Systems executed a large-scale, peace-time pivot to become the African Assembly’s leading designer of high-speed goods conveyors. Now producing a range of chute network designs and components, TK has a strong offworld presence as a result of the Afro-Sino partnerships in the latter 21st Century. Based in the ‘reconned’ Kigamboni district of Dar E Salaam, the Company regularly enters into development partnerships with {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} and, as a result, many of their products show distinct similarities. After all, what is a gun but a ‘high speed goods conveyor’.

Now producing a range of chute network designs and components, TK has a strong offworld presence as a result of the Afro-Sino partnerships in the latter 21st Century. data.name: Interface_XigoDesc
data.value: A 2150CE survey revealed the Xigo 'X' as one of the most recognized symbols in the world. Yet few participants could clearly describe the company's actual scope. Precisely where the company begins and ends has been the subject of endless theories, financial studies and lawsuits – originally a website for price comparisons, the conglomerate expanded to embrace data, then distribution and finally production. It was a seemingly indiscriminate expansion, focused not on one industry, but all of them – taking in so many fields that business analysts have largely rejected the idea of Xigo as a single entity. Rather, it is a conceptual grouping for a branch of human activity. And while such statistics are – by their very nature – difficult to confirm, recent estimates suggest Xigo employs over 1.5% of the entire human race. Suffice to say, it produces almost everything.

data.name: Interface_StationeersDesc
data.value: In the early 22nd century, Earth was emerging from a cataclysm. Its resources eroded, our population reduced, rebuilding was the spirit of the era. Initiated by the {LINK:ODA;Offworld Development Agency} (ODA) in 2095CE, the Stationeers Program was dedicated to a single ideal: keeping humanity pointed at the stars. Stationeers are everything: astronauts, engineers and explorers, deployed with limited equipment and tools, trained to do more with less. Turning the environment to their advantage, their job is to provide infrastructure for humans in space, at a fraction of the cost of traditional space programs. Able to build and maintain bases anywhere from the Moon to Mimas and beyond, Stationeers are our vanguard in the cosmos. Schooled in offworld survival, mining and construction techniques, basic metallurgy, electronics, rocketry, hydroponics and more ‘arcane’ sciences, Stationeers do what they must to survive, and thrive. Renowned for having no entry criteria, there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ Stationeer. Psychological profiling suggests successful Cadets show a ‘baseline’ pragmatism and single-mindedness, but some of the most famous Stationeers possess neither of these qualities. Recruiting from civil engineering backgrounds, military and aerospace industries, software development, mining groups, as well as scientific fields and even religious orders, the Stationeers Program is – fundamentally – open to all humanity.

Initiated by the {LINK:ODA;Offworld Development Agency} (ODA) in 2095CE, the Stationeers Program was dedicated to a single ideal: keeping humanity pointed at the stars. Stationeers are everything: astronauts, engineers and explorers, deployed with limited equipment and tools, trained to do more with less. Turning the environment to their advantage, their job is to provide infrastructure for humans in space, at a fraction of the cost of traditional space programs. Able to build and maintain bases anywhere from the Moon to Mimas and beyond, Stationeers are our vanguard in the cosmos. Schooled in offworld survival, mining and construction techniques, basic metallurgy, electronics, rocketry, hydroponics and more ‘arcane’ sciences, Stationeers do what they must to survive, and thrive. Renowned for having no entry criteria, there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ Stationeer. Psychological profiling suggests successful Cadets show a ‘baseline’ pragmatism and single-mindedness, but some of the most famous Stationeers possess neither of these qualities. Recruiting from civil engineering backgrounds, military and aerospace industries, software development, mining groups, as well as scientific fields and even religious orders, the Stationeers Program is – fundamentally – open to all humanity.

data.name: Interface_MoleOxygenDescription
data.value: Oxygen provides energy when released in combustion, and also bonds with hydrogen to create {GAS:Water}. It is created by {LINK:OrganicPage;plants}, as well as from processing {THING:ItemOxite}. It is highly flammable at low temperatures.
data.comment: Oxygen provides energy when released in combustion, and also bonds with hydrogen to create {GAS:Water}. It is created by {LINK:OrganicPage;plants}, as well as from processing {THING:ItemOxite}. It is highly flammable at low temperatures.

data.name: Interface_MoleNitrogenDescription
data.value: {GAS:Nitrogen} can be mixed with {GAS:Oxygen} to stabilize its flammability and avoid {GAS:Oxygen} toxicity, and is a resource in its own right, useful for creating, a breathable atmosphere (at roughly 3:1 {GAS:Nitrogen} and {GAS:Oxygen}). The most efficient source of {GAS:Nitrogen} is from {THING:ItemNitrice} deposites found around the Solar System. You can Condense {GAS:Nitrogen} into {GAS:LiquidNitrogen} by lowering its temperature below its boiling point.
data.comment: {GAS:Nitrogen} can be mixed with {GAS:Oxygen} to stabilize its flammability and avoid {GAS:Oxygen} toxicity, and is a resource in its own right, useful for creating, a breathable atmosphere (at roughly 3:1 {GAS:Nitrogen} and {GAS:Oxygen}). The most efficient source of {GAS:Nitrogen} is from {THING:ItemNitrice} deposites found around the Solar System. You can Condense {GAS:Nitrogen} into {GAS:LiquidNitrogen} by lowering its temperature below its boiling point.

data.name: Interface_MoleCarbonDioxideDescription
data.value:
You breathe it out, {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} breath it in. They don't grow without it. You can use items placed in {SLOT:GasFilter} slots to remove this from the atmosphere.
{GAS:CarbonDioxide} has a moderately high specific heat, meaning it makes a good coolant for devices like the Wall Coo {THING:StructureWallCooler}. {GAS:Water} is better, but usually has more important uses.
data.comment:
You breathe it out, {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} breath it in. They don't grow without it. You can use items placed in {SLOT:GasFilter} slots to remove this from the atmosphere.
{GAS:CarbonDioxide} has a moderately high specific heat, meaning it makes a good coolant for devices like the Wall Coo {THING:StructureWallCooler}. {GAS:Water} is better, but usually has more important uses.

data.name: Interface_MoleVolatilesDescription
data.value:
Volatiles are an extremely reactive, complex organic molecule, which can be used in conjunction with oxygen as a combustible fuel. It is refined from {THING:ItemVolatiles}.
Due to obscure and largely forgotten {LINK:ODA;ODA} regulations, volatiles are sometimes labeled 'H2' by various items of technology. However, though they are similar to hydrogen, they're not 'actually' hydrogen. {GAS:Volatiles} will not produce {GAS:Water} when combusted, without a catalyst (see the {THING:H2Combustor}). Alone, they create {GAS:Pollutant}s and {GAS:CarbonDioxide} when burned in the following ratio:
2 {GAS:Volatiles} + 1 {GAS:Oxygen} -> 3 {GAS:Pollutant} + 6 {GAS:CarbonDioxide} + heat.
data.comment:
Volatiles are an extremely reactive, complex organic molecule, which can be used in conjunction with oxygen as a combustible fuel. It is refined from {THING:ItemVolatiles}.
Due to obscure and largely forgotten {LINK:ODA;ODA} regulations, volatiles are sometimes labeled 'H2' by various items of technology. However, though they are similar to hydrogen, they're not 'actually' hydrogen. {GAS:Volatiles} will not produce {GAS:Water} when combusted, without a catalyst (see the {THING:H2Combustor}). Alone, they create {GAS:Pollutant}s and {GAS:CarbonDioxide} when burned in the following ratio:
2 {GAS:Volatiles} + 1 {GAS:Oxygen} -> 3 {GAS:Pollutant} + 6 {GAS:CarbonDioxide} + heat.

data.name: Interface_MolePollutantDescription
data.value:
Also known as 'X', {GAS:Pollutant} is created when smelting certain metals. A concentration of 0.1 mol or greater will cause your suit to warn about poison in the atmosphere.
Pollutant has a high specific heat, making it an excellent coolant. Unfortunately it is extremely bad for organic beings, and will severely damage the lungs of most {REAGENT:Carbon} based organisms.
data.comment:
Also known as 'X', {GAS:Pollutant} is created when smelting certain metals. A concentration of 0.1 mol or greater will cause your suit to warn about poison in the atmosphere.
Pollutant has a high specific heat, making it an excellent coolant. Unfortunately it is extremely bad for organic beings, and will severely damage the lungs of most {REAGENT:Carbon} based organisms.

data.name: Interface_MoleWaterDescription
data.value: You can obtain water by smelting or crushing {THING:ItemIce} using a {THING:StructureFurnace} or an {THING:StructureIceCrusher}. {GAS:Water} is critical for {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} to stay alive, and grow {LINK:NutritionPage;food}. It is also an exceptional coolant with a very high specific heat capacity. {GAS:Water} will evaporate into {GAS:Steam} if it's temperature is raised above its boiling point.
data.comment: You can obtain water by smelting or crushing {THING:ItemIce} using a {THING:StructureFurnace} or an {THING:StructureIceCrusher}. {GAS:Water} is critical for {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} to stay alive, and grow {LINK:NutritionPage;food}. It is also an exceptional coolant with a very high specific heat capacity. {GAS:Water} will evaporate into {GAS:Steam} if it's temperature is raised above its boiling point.

data.name: Interface_MoleNitrousOxideDescription
data.value: Nitrous oxide is a reactive gas that will knock players out if inhaled. It acts as an oxidizer for combustion, and allows volatiles to burn significantly hotter, faster, and at a lower autoignition temperature. It can be produced in an energy intensive process inside of a {THING:StructureNitrolyzer}.
data.comment: Nitrous oxide is a reactive gas that will knock players out if inhaled. It acts as an oxidizer for combustion, and allows volatiles to burn significantly hotter, faster, and at a lower autoignition temperature. It can be produced in an energy intensive process inside of a {THING:StructureNitrolyzer}.

data.name: Interface_MoleLiquidNitrogenDescription
data.value: {GAS:Nitrogen} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Nitrogen} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidNitrogen} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Nitrogen}.
data.comment: {GAS:Nitrogen} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Nitrogen} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidNitrogen} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Nitrogen}.

data.name: Interface_MoleLiquidOxygenDescription
data.value: {GAS:Oxygen} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Oxygen} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidOxygen} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Oxygen}.
data.comment: {GAS:Oxygen} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Oxygen} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidOxygen} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Oxygen}.

data.name: Interface_MoleLiquidVolatilesDescription
data.value: {GAS:Volatiles} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Volatiles} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidVolatiles} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Volatiles}.
data.comment: {GAS:Volatiles} in its liquid form. It can be created by lowering the temperature of {GAS:Volatiles} gas below it's boiling point. This can be achieved using a {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas} or a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}. {GAS:LiquidVolatiles} introduced into the atmosphere will quickly evaporate back into {GAS:Volatiles}.

data.name: Interface_MoleSteamDescription
data.value: Evaporated {GAS:Water}. It can be created by rasing the temperature of {GAS:Water} to its boiling point. When introduced into a pipe {GAS:Steam} will condense back into {GAS:Water} if it's temperature is below it's boiling point. Steam can be created by combusting {GAS:Volatiles} and oxygen using the {THING:H2Combustor}
data.comment: Evaporated {GAS:Water}. It can be created by rasing the temperature of {GAS:Water} to its boiling point. When introduced into a pipe {GAS:Steam} will condense back into {GAS:Water} if it's temperature is below it's boiling point. Steam can be created by combusting {GAS:Volatiles} and oxygen using the {THING:H2Combustor}

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionSrl
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical right shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the right and fills the vacated leftmost bits with zeros
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical right shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the right and fills the vacated leftmost bits with zeros

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionSra
data.value: Performs a bitwise arithmetic right shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the right and fills the vacated leftmost bits with a copy of the sign bit (the most significant bit).
data.comment: Performs a bitwise arithmetic right shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the right and fills the vacated leftmost bits with a copy of the sign bit (the most significant bit).

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionSll
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical left shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the left and fills the vacated rightmost bits with zeros.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical left shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the left and fills the vacated rightmost bits with zeros.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionSla
data.value: Performs a bitwise arithmetic left shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the left and fills the vacated rightmost bits with a copy of the sign bit (the most significant bit).
data.comment: Performs a bitwise arithmetic left shift operation on the binary representation of a value. It shifts the bits to the left and fills the vacated rightmost bits with a copy of the sign bit (the most significant bit).

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionNot
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation flipping each bit of the input value, resulting in a binary complement. If a bit is 1, it becomes 0, and if a bit is 0, it becomes 1.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation flipping each bit of the input value, resulting in a binary complement. If a bit is 1, it becomes 0, and if a bit is 0, it becomes 1.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionAnd
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If both bits are 1, the resulting bit is set to 1. Otherwise the resulting bit is set to 0.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If both bits are 1, the resulting bit is set to 1. Otherwise the resulting bit is set to 0.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionOr
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If either bit is 1, the resulting bit is set to 1. If both bits are 0, the resulting bit is set to 0.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If either bit is 1, the resulting bit is set to 1. If both bits are 0, the resulting bit is set to 0.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionXor
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical XOR (exclusive OR) operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If the bits are different (one bit is 0 and the other is 1), the resulting bit is set to 1. If the bits are the same (both 0 or both 1), the resulting bit is set to 0.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical XOR (exclusive OR) operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If the bits are different (one bit is 0 and the other is 1), the resulting bit is set to 1. If the bits are the same (both 0 or both 1), the resulting bit is set to 0.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionNor
data.value: Performs a bitwise logical NOR (NOT OR) operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If both bits are 0, the resulting bit is set to 1. Otherwise, if at least one bit is 1, the resulting bit is set to 0.
data.comment: Performs a bitwise logical NOR (NOT OR) operation on the binary representation of two values. Each bit of the result is determined by evaluating the corresponding bits of the input values. If both bits are 0, the resulting bit is set to 1. Otherwise, if at least one bit is 1, the resulting bit is set to 0.

data.name: GameString_ScriptDescriptionSbn
data.value: Stores register value to LogicType on all output network devices with provided type hash and name.
data.comment: Stores register value to LogicType on all output network devices with provided type hash and name.
